If you are looking for small BYOB joint with amazing food and great service at a great price, look no further. A dive style restaurant with a cash register older than dirt but this place is super clean. This spot is so small and unique they use electronic space heaters! This place seats about 22 with a small bar that can seat 4. The jambalaya and pulled pork were both delicious but I would have to give the jambalaya the upper hand. A mix of mussels, shrimp, pork, chicken and creamy rice with a slight kick. Spicy fries get an A+ but the only disappointing part of my evening at Juniper was they were all out of their glorious mac n cheese. The waitstaff was great and its on the cheap side and there is some cool scurban art on the walls. Also note this place is cash ONLY but they do have an atm on site with a $1.75 fee.
This place is great.  The mac n cheese is so legit.  Mussels and Jumbalaya were delicious too.  AlsoBYOB and no corkage fee! awesome. service is great too.

Place is overrated. Went there with my family and we were the only ones in the whole place. The food took forever and the food was mediocre.. I ordered the Shrimp Cajun Salad and although the shrimp itself was delicious, they drenched the salad (my moms and mine) in balsamic vinegarette  to the point that it ruined my salad and my lips were burning. The best thing there were the sweet potato fries. They didn't ask us once how the food was or if we needed anything. We were the ONLY people there. BTW, it only takes cash and does not serve alcoholic beverages but you can bring your own. There's plenty of other options around that kick this place's ass. Don't waste your time.

Been here a few times now and I will still keep coming back. The food is good if you're looking for filling and savoury. The portions are generous for what you pay. It's BYOB, which means your tab will not exponentially grow. The service is not really something to make a big fuss about. This is a very laid back place run a by people who may not have strong background in hospitality, but want to offer fun comfort food with affordable prices in a not so affordable neighbourhood. I really liked either their Truffle burger or Chorizo burger. Their wings are really good too. Don't come here with expectations of a full-service restaurant with well tailored customer service. Just lay back, relax, have fun, and enjoy the food!

Bring cash.I find that the mussels & my shrimp linguine was too salty. Maybe the chef added salt twice. Sadly I won't be back to give this place a 2nd chance. But if I did, I will request for "no salt"
Love this place. Food is great! And the owners are super nice. Make sure you try to the catfish sandwich and spicy fries. So good! Their patio is a great place to host a dinner too!
Food is excellent. Small. Quaint lil joint. Spicy fries are good. Ribs and BBQ sauce are spectacular.

Happened by this place while strolling down Berry St. The inside is tiny and the white walls kinda freaked me out, but the artwork is cool and the super antique cash register is intriguing. I got the steak and cheese sandwich which was essentially a Philly cheesesteak on a brioche bun--not what I was expecting but omfg delicious. My bf's bacon cheeseburger was so juicy and both of our spicy & sweet potato fries were yummy. The staff (the like 2 of them) seems very nice and we waited hardly 10 mins for our food (on a Friday night!). Come here.

If there were more than 5 stars available, this place would have that. Went last night. Had the burger. This has to go on the Best Burger List for NYC. Not for Brooklyn. For the entire friggin city.Ordered the Truffle Burger and added Gouda and Bacon (cause let's face it, you have to have bacon on a burger). This was such a juicy burger, it soaked the bottom of the bun. It was out of this world good. No ketchup was needed. This place is immediately on my list of best burgers in the city. Little Owl, Minetta, JG Melon, Royale, Juniper. No order in particular, but Juniper is that good. My girlfriend wanted to try the mac and cheese, had a bite. Wow. They warned us it was going to take 25 minutes from the time we ordered for all the food because they make the mac and cheese from scratch. It tasted like home mad mac and cheese. It was fantastic. This place is BYOB, which is an added bonus. There's a wine shop across the street where we got wine from. We still haven't tried the Jambalaya or the seafood, that's next up though. To top it off, the owner came by and say hi at the end (he was in the kitchen before). We told him how good the food was and he was so nice and gracious. He talked about the BYOB and that he does this vs having a liquor license so he can keep the prices down. What more can you ask for than someone who cares about his business and his customers. A must-stop in Williamsburg

Juniper makes some of the best burgers/fries in town (their whole menu is great, though--check out their Cobb salad and seafood pasta), and is BYOB, which is great.However, they also have some of the slowest service I've ever experienced. Be ready to wait 45 minutes for a couple burgers. Have been here a bunch of times and always had the same experience. But the fantastic food at reasonable prices keeps me coming back.

Been to Juniper more than 10 times. Excellent burger. Excellent spicy fries. Cash only but it's also BYOB which is a total win. Had the catfish sandwich last night. Batter is very light. 2 large pieces of catfish. My wife had the truffle burger (I had half of that as well) and that was slamming too. The chef came by and recommended the rib sandwich which I didnt see on the menu. Actually considering heading over for lunch today. With tip our bill was around $40. Love this spot!

A weekend lunch at Juniper earlier this fall turned into a a game to test our levels of resourcefulness and patience. Test 1: How to sit in their outdoor garden without burning, as only 1 table out of 5 had an umbrella. We kept shifting toward the restaurant and took turns in the sun. We got to be human sundials!Test 2: How to eat a pot of mussels without utensils. I learned something new. You use one half of the mussel to loosen up the meat on the other half, and then enjoy. (Truth be told, they were quite yummy). Test 3: How long can you go without laughing at the granny panties hanging on the drying line of the apartment next door? Test 4: How long do we have to wait? Answer: forever o'clock. Our truffle burgers were okay; juicy but lacking in flavor. Fries were crispy and savory. Well, we passed all the tests with flying colors, although we felt defeated upon leaving. Service was kind, but slow (they were short-staffed, so this is forgivable). Juniper's final grade: 3 stars.

Reasonably priced menu with huge portions of tasty comfort food. BYOB is always great too. Highly recomended!

Good food, great prices, great service. There is also an outside area which is pretty good. BYOB is awesome. Cash only. It's too bad they don't offer any clear diet drinks, so if you want to mix drinks you'll need to stick to rum/whiskey.

Went to Juniper with a large group of friends and had an AWESOME time! There wasn't a table for us so we waited around the bar area but we were able to place an order before we were seated to expedite the process.Had the Truffle Burger, the Jambalaya, Fish and Chips - everything was PHENOMENAL. Will def be back~~Not sure if the guy working there was the owner or manager but regardless, he was awesome. Honestly!! In an area where everyone feels so entitled (for who knows what reason), this place makes you feel like you are at home. Actually, might be better than home HAHA so accommodating!!The food is amazing and the owner is awesome, BYOB - what else could you possibly ask for?! Will definitely have to come back to try the Mac and Cheese!!
Super friendly staff, you can bring your own beer- and food was okay. Slightly pricey for what you get.

The service was great. The one gentleman who was at the bar also tended to the tables and was polite as well as attentive. The pulled pork sliders were delicious and the steak sandwich was  great. Not greasy and the cheese was just the right amount. The street potato fries may have been the frozen kind, but were cooked well. The Mac and cheese was bland. Tastes like the boxed kind with breadcrumbs on it. Overall a great place. Would definitely go back for the pulled pork sliders.

Came here with a six pack and five friends hoping to split some appetizers and drink some beers before heading to an event.First of all, ignore the reviews that say that there's no corking fee. It's $1 per beer and $5 for a bottle of wine, and you have to open them yourself although they provide a bottle opener. I was considering leaving upon hearing that but decided to stay as I was only going to have one beer, but, regardless, that was the first strike (actually second, after it being cash only).When we finally ordered, our table of six got some sliders, some chicken wings and a burger. So, not much food but considering we were already paying per beer we felt like it would be fine. Apparently not, as the server quickly let us know that they "usually don't do this, but since you guys are a big table and you only got like three apps, and we get busy on Saturday nights, maybe you should keep an eye on the time" (paraphrased slightly, but that was the gist). This was at around 7 and the restaurant, while populated, was by no means even close to full or even busy. So, that was my cue to get out of there. Unfortunately didn't get to try the food but after that whole experience I don't think I will.

Walking into Juniper, I was taken aback by how small it is with limited seating in the front.  We must have hit it just right, being seated immediately, because people started rolling in in droves, each carrying a bottle of wine or six pack of beer.  Did I mention it's BYOB?  There must be a black hole through the kitchen because a whole slew of people went through there.  Apparently there's some nice garden seating out the back.DO NOT call this diner food.  This is comfort food at it's best.  Tom, the chef & owner serves up some of the most amazing dishes from an albeit limited menu, but makes each dish his own and with a lotta love & care.  To say that the menu is eclectic is an understatement.  It is a true American melting pot from all over the country with the chef adding his signature, accents & spins on classics.  He even made it a point to come out during a lull in the kitchen to greet his guests and make sure everybody liked their food.We started with the (mmmmm) catfish poppers & mussels w/wine, garlic & shallots.  The mussels were on the small side, but went really well with the shallots on top of crustini.  The broth of the mussels was so good, we were using the half shells as spoons and drinking it as soup!  I really couldn't decide on an entree because I wanted to try everything from the Truffle burger to the Jambalaya.  I decided to lay off the meat and go with the Linguini & Shrimp, which at $15 was the most expensive dish on the menu (along with the Jambalaya), super bargains.  It came with 7 colossal shrimp in a similar broth as the mussels but with parmesan cheese for added depth.  The rest of the family had Pulled Pork & Catfish sandwiches & the Jambalaya.  We even shared a huge green salad to add some roughage in there.  We saw the mac & cheese at the next table and it was HUGE!  We'll have to try that next time.When Peter D gives it 5 stars, you better well show up there with your cash in hand.  Oh and it is cash only.
Juniper's the best. Best burgers in the 11249/11211. I've eaten here once a week since I can't remember when. But, they just raised their prices of the cheapest burger from $10 to $13. Sigh.

unless you're a 24 year old i-banker making $300k/ year who lives in one of those huge towers on kent & north 6th and you put on your chill ass vans and a vneck to stumble out into smorgasburg every sunday morning for a five dollar "cold brew" and are o.k. with dropping $30+ on mussels / eel burger / veal tar-tar on seamless every weeknight, you will completely run out of places to eat after about a week of living in williamsburg in 2015. the burgers at juniper are always great and sometimes the specials are pretty tight too. served fast and the staff is always really nice and attentive. one of the few no-bullshit places left in this neighborhood; I hope they can survive.

We came here after coming from another restaurant nearby because of a pretty bad experience. The storefront looked pretty bare but we walked in where there was 1 table and our server behind the bar. Their menu was pretty simple but we ended up with the Jambalaya and Catfish sandwich with the spicy fries. The Jambalaya was had a ton of mussels and sausage, a couple of shakes of hot sauce and it was almost perfect. My girlfriend got the Catfish sandwich and she enjoyed it all, which was pretty gi-normous and came with a decent heap of fries. Fortunately, she couldn't finish but I was able to finish my Jambalaya and still make room for the leftover she had so I can honestly say that the catfish sammie and fries were definitely a good choice.Service wise there were no bumps. Our server went out of her way to find a bottle of ginger beer for me. She came by fairly regularly to check on us and the other table. The food takes a little while but I think it's because they have to work with  small kitchen.
Reasonably priced menu with huge portions of tasty comfort food. BYOB is always great too. Highly recomended!

Good food, great prices, great service. There is also an outside area which is pretty good. BYOB is awesome. Cash only. It's too bad they don't offer any clear diet drinks, so if you want to mix drinks you'll need to stick to rum/whiskey.

Went to Juniper with a large group of friends and had an AWESOME time! There wasn't a table for us so we waited around the bar area but we were able to place an order before we were seated to expedite the process.Had the Truffle Burger, the Jambalaya, Fish and Chips - everything was PHENOMENAL. Will def be back~~Not sure if the guy working there was the owner or manager but regardless, he was awesome. Honestly!! In an area where everyone feels so entitled (for who knows what reason), this place makes you feel like you are at home. Actually, might be better than home HAHA so accommodating!!The food is amazing and the owner is awesome, BYOB - what else could you possibly ask for?! Will definitely have to come back to try the Mac and Cheese!!
Super friendly staff, you can bring your own beer- and food was okay. Slightly pricey for what you get.

The service was great. The one gentleman who was at the bar also tended to the tables and was polite as well as attentive. The pulled pork sliders were delicious and the steak sandwich was  great. Not greasy and the cheese was just the right amount. The street potato fries may have been the frozen kind, but were cooked well. The Mac and cheese was bland. Tastes like the boxed kind with breadcrumbs on it. Overall a great place. Would definitely go back for the pulled pork sliders.

Came here with a six pack and five friends hoping to split some appetizers and drink some beers before heading to an event.First of all, ignore the reviews that say that there's no corking fee. It's $1 per beer and $5 for a bottle of wine, and you have to open them yourself although they provide a bottle opener. I was considering leaving upon hearing that but decided to stay as I was only going to have one beer, but, regardless, that was the first strike (actually second, after it being cash only).When we finally ordered, our table of six got some sliders, some chicken wings and a burger. So, not much food but considering we were already paying per beer we felt like it would be fine. Apparently not, as the server quickly let us know that they "usually don't do this, but since you guys are a big table and you only got like three apps, and we get busy on Saturday nights, maybe you should keep an eye on the time" (paraphrased slightly, but that was the gist). This was at around 7 and the restaurant, while populated, was by no means even close to full or even busy. So, that was my cue to get out of there. Unfortunately didn't get to try the food but after that whole experience I don't think I will.

The Jambalaya was had a ton of mussels and sausage, a couple of shakes of hot sauce and it was almost perfect. My girlfriend got the Catfish sandwich and she enjoyed it all, which was pretty gi-normous and came with a decent heap of fries. Fortunately, she couldn't finish but I was able to finish my Jambalaya and still make room for the leftover she had so I can honestly say that the catfish sammie and fries were definitely a good choice.Service wise there were no bumps. Our server went out of her way to find a bottle of ginger beer for me. She came by fairly regularly to check on us and the other table. The food takes a little while but I think it's because they have to work with  small kitchen.
If you want some good burgers and comfort food come here. Nothing fancy, just good food, near the L, and consistent. Cash only.
terrible service...not the sharpest tools in the shed

It's over 90 degrees outside (hot and humid) and you want some lunch in W-burg and temporary air conditioned shelter,  so you come to Juniper right?  Not exactly...Cons:1.  Barely any air conditioning the day I went.  It was extremely hot outside and felt even hotter inside.   We had a pregnant woman in our group so I'm knocking off one star for the lack of cool air and uncomfortable dining experience.2.  Grilled Cheese - it was a good grilled cheese, but nothing different than what I make at home.  Maybe a cheese like gruyere would have made it better.3.  Hubbie had the portabella sandwich and he liked it.   I thought the bun got too soggy in the middle from the mushroom juices.4.  No veggie burger on the menu?   I feel jipped. Pros:1.  The fries.  Hot and cripsy, just the way I like my fries.  The spicy ones are great because they really have a kick to them.2.  Mac and Cheese - pretty delicious and the rice krispie like things on top gave the dish a nice texture.  The cheese was just the right amount of gooey.3.  The place was relatively empty on a Sunday afternoon so it was easy to have a relaxed group lunch.4.  BYOB.This place is decent, but Williamsburg is filled with cute lunch/dinner spots, so I probably wouldn't return here.
Best burger in Williamsburg. Always get the spicy fries. Also, try the wings; they are delicious.
THEY HAVE A CORKAGE FEE!!! brought a 6 pack and was charged $6. they didnt keep it keep it cool or nothing.

Awesome food, great service and friendly staff. I ordered the cajun seafood pasta and it was so good and hearty.  The portions are so big that we had to take home some left overs. This place is definitely a to go too whenever I'm visiting my daughter here in Williamsburg. The food are all reasonably priced. The best part is they don't charge corkage fee. Love this place!

Quirky, informal, slow, cozy, delicious.The food here is amazing. Slow cooked BBQ ribs, pulled pork, fried chicken... On and on, this is a real culinary delight. This is not the usual fry it up joint, or even a standard bbq joint, this is crafting with care. Occasionally you will find one small item here or there that misses the mark a bit, but over and over again, their meals are so damn good. Don't come here expecting to rush, come here when you want to relax, enjoy the cozy inside or the pleasant garden. The service is a sometimes super attentive and friendly -- but often very slow -- the meals can take a while to come out. Go there *knowing* this, and also knowing that, oh man, when it does come out it's well worth it. In line with their informal, non-NY vibe, sometimes they aren't open when you show up earlier in the day. The posted hours are that they open at 11am, but I recommend calling ahead anytime you want to come by before 5pm to make sure they are there.
Love this place. Great wings and Tommy the owner is the best! Nice to have a place like this in Williamsburg. Just about good food and you feel at home. BYOB! Works for me.
Stopped in hoping to grab a burger, but it was fairly dead inside and ended up stopping in at a burger joint on the next corner.

Awesome place. Started off with the BBQ wings & chicken tenders. The BBQ sauce had a wonderful sweet taste with the right amount of kick that didn't make you sit straight up with every bite. The chicken tenders had a nice panko style breading which came with a type of hot mustard for dipping.Decided to also try the rib sandwich, which was very tender & drenched in that same BBQ sauce. I thought it was going to be a mess but it held together nicely. The sweet potato fries were good, however not exceptional. Should have gone with the spicy fries, which someone else at our table ordered & which were loaded with flavor. In addition, the burger that this person also ordered rivaled any gourmet burger I have either seen or tried. Definitely a must try for my next visit.A few downsides would be that unfortunately they don't serve beer. However our host/waiter (who was friendly & attentive) made some suggestions on where we could buy some & bring it in to enjoy our dinner. Also, the place is not too big so seating could be an issue on a busy night. Finally, don't forget to come with cash since credit cards are not accepted.Overall, the place definitely doesn't try to be too fancy... Juniper just gives you a great comfort food experience.
If you want some good burgers and comfort food come here. Nothing fancy, just good food, near the L, and consistent. Cash only.
terrible service...not the sharpest tools in the shed

Best burger in Williamsburg. Always get the spicy fries. Also, try the wings; they are delicious.

The chicken tenders had a nice panko style breading which came with a type of hot mustard for dipping.Decided to also try the rib sandwich, which was very tender & drenched in that same BBQ sauce. I thought it was going to be a mess but it held together nicely. The sweet potato fries were good, however not exceptional. Should have gone with the spicy fries, which someone else at our table ordered & which were loaded with flavor. In addition, the burger that this person also ordered rivaled any gourmet burger I have either seen or tried. Definitely a must try for my next visit.A few downsides would be that unfortunately they don't serve beer. However our host/waiter (who was friendly & attentive) made some suggestions on where we could buy some & bring it in to enjoy our dinner. Also, the place is not too big so seating could be an issue on a busy night. Finally, don't forget to come with cash since credit cards are not accepted.Overall, the place definitely doesn't try to be too fancy... Juniper just gives you a great comfort food experience.

I love this place.Location: located in central williamsburg but berry street is not as crowded as bedford. Small restaurant with garden. Music was playing in the front - not too loud. There was no music in the garden. I liked this a lot because it is quite hard to find a good place around in which music does not play at festival noise level.Service: there were two waiters. They were very friendly and attentive. Always checking on our wishes.Food: i had the grilled burger with spicy fries. It comes with a side salad. This was one of the best burgers i ever had. The meat was very juicy and had a great texture. There were no greasy sauces added beforehand so i only added a tiny bit of ketchup and some cucumber - turned out perfect. The bun was golden brown and fluffy. The fries were a-m-a-z-i-n-g. So crunchy with a great texture fried to golden perfection.

My husband and I had dinner here last night. It was fairly early for dinner (we missed lunch) so we wound up being the only ones in there. Service was casual but attentive and the place was small and cozy with not too many tables. I ordered the truffle burger with the spicy fries and my husband ordered the pulled pork sandwich with regular fries. The food was amazing. The pulled pork was seasoned just right not too dry or overloaded with sauce. The burger was delicious, such a clean flavor and it wasn't overloaded with truffle oil to the point of only tasting that I ordered it with swiss which added to the flavor. The portions are big!! The spicy fries were so good but I wasn't able to eat many because I was determined to finish that burger because it was so good.  We def want to return to try the Mac and cheese.

Service, foods and the price was A +++I love that they have small hidden backyardAnd It's BYOB!! Jambalaya and truffle burger was so good. One star off for the cash only thing. Everything else was perfect!

My friend brought me here on recommendation from her friend. It was supposed to be a delicious burger.So, I tried the classic bacon cheeseburger. I must say, it was one of the best burgers, if not the best, I ever had. The meat was perfectly flavored, and my medium rare burger was juicy, but not so juicy as to sog up and make the bun collapse. I took the sweet potato fries along with that, and the chef here makes sure they taste like sweet potato. No worry that you'll order sweet potato fries and get a bland, soggy, orange french fry.I was here on a Tuesday night, and it was empty.

My boyfriend and I went here after trying to find a good BYOB place.  The staff was very friendly and attentive, which was great.  Right when we walked in they saw that we had a bottle of wine and gave us 2 glasses and asked if we needed a wine key. LOVE that there isn't a corkage fee, major bonus! We ordered the mac and cheese, pulled pork sando and bacon cheese burger (med-rare) They were also playing the basketball game which was a big plus too.The mac and cheese was very bland. Even eating it the next day with lots of spices added from home there just wasn't much flavor. Lots of cheese, somehow no flavor.  The pulled pork was good, nothing to write home about but a solid sandwich. The sweet potato fries we got with it were under cooked, however my boyfriend didn't want to send them back so I can't comment on how they would have tasted had they been cooked properly. The burger was good, cooked well, very juicy, the bacon was delicious (when is it not?) and the bun was decent.  The spicy fries are by far the best!! I would highly recommend those above everything else.Overall a decent experience, I may go back simply for the BYOB option.

My friends and I come here once in a while and we always love going there.It's a cozy place in the front of house. It can get a little tight, but it's still comfortable. The old fashioned big metal cash register is an interesting touch as well.The staff is great and super friendly from the owner, who comes out of the back to have a friendly conversation with you, to the young kid who waits on the tables. I always try to give the kid a decent tip because he seems like a great kid.They have a place to sit out in the back during the spring and summer and it's a great place for some fresh air and conversation with your friends while you eat and drink.They have a BYOB (bring your own beer) policy and will chill it for you and serve it to you.The last time my friends and I went there was maybe a month ago and we ordered appetizers and brought a couple of six packs of beer with us. We had to leave after the appetizers to catch a UFC fight on PPV and they actually held our beer for us until we came back like an hour or two later. They have great American style food that isn't too expensive either. My friends usually get the Jambalaya and Mac & Cheese and swear by them. I'm more of a burger type guy. The first time I went there I had the Truffle Burger with fries and it was pretty delicious. One time I also had the Shrimp Salad and it was pretty good. They have pretty good wings too.Overall it's a great place!

A not so pretentious restaurant that serves quality food and great service at a reasonable price. Even better, this is BYOB! The truffle burger was very juicy, but could use sightly more seasoning. The pulled pork sandwich was just right. Spicy fries and sweet potato fries both have a nice twist. There's a cute backyard that can be perfect for a breezy summer night. The waiter was very nice and consistently made sure our glasses were filled. Even the chef made a point of coming out to talk to every table. It's rare to find a restaurant with people that really cares!
Bang for ze . Pulled pork sandwich is prime. I had the Cajun shrimp salad--a bit healthier. There's a patio in the back!

I came for lunch on a Friday at 1:30. There was one other table occupied. Our food took 30 minutes to come and was mediocre, at best. The fries were really the only tasty part. My wife had a chicken sandwich special with avocado. The avocado was unripe and hard. Why have a special when a crucial ingredient isn't ready to serve? I won't return to this restaurant.

Oh hell yes. Not only did I have one of the best burgers I've ever eaten IN MY LIFE, the chef and server were so nice that we were basically friends at the end of the meal.When my friend suggested this spot, I almost protested because it is three things that I don't love: it's in Williamsburg (so hard to get to from Crown Heights), it's cash-only, and it's BYOB. I am so glad I did not protest. What a gem! What a treat! I had the truffle burger, which was just the most perfectly medium-cooked patty, topped with sauteed portobello slices and drizzled in truffle oil. I almost have truffle fatigue at this point, but the craftsmanship of this burger made this flavor combination seem as fresh as the first time I tried it. Tom the cook and Raphael the server are great people. Raphael was super friendly and was joking around with us within a few minutes, and Tom came out from the kitchen to chat about the restaurant business and the changing neighborhood. We had the best time. Krystal, I'll never doubt you again. You pick all the places we go from now on.

The waiter was very nice and consistently made sure our glasses were filled. Even the chef made a point of coming out to talk to every table. It's rare to find a restaurant with people that really cares!
Bang for ze . Pulled pork sandwich is prime. I had the Cajun shrimp salad--a bit healthier. There's a patio in the back!

I came for lunch on a Friday at 1:30. There was one other table occupied. Our food took 30 minutes to come and was mediocre, at best. The fries were really the only tasty part. My wife had a chicken sandwich special with avocado. The avocado was unripe and hard. Why have a special when a crucial ingredient isn't ready to serve? I won't return to this restaurant.

Oh hell yes. Not only did I have one of the best burgers I've ever eaten IN MY LIFE, the chef and server were so nice that we were basically friends at the end of the meal.When my friend suggested this spot, I almost protested because it is three things that I don't love: it's in Williamsburg (so hard to get to from Crown Heights), it's cash-only, and it's BYOB. I am so glad I did not protest. What a gem! What a treat! I had the truffle burger, which was just the most perfectly medium-cooked patty, topped with sauteed portobello slices and drizzled in truffle oil. I almost have truffle fatigue at this point, but the craftsmanship of this burger made this flavor combination seem as fresh as the first time I tried it. Tom the cook and Raphael the server are great people. Raphael was super friendly and was joking around with us within a few minutes, and Tom came out from the kitchen to chat about the restaurant business and the changing neighborhood. We had the best time. Krystal, I'll never doubt you again. You pick all the places we go from now on.

The food is always tasty here.  Service is excellent, especially if you get the young man who whizzes around doing everything (greet, take orders, bring food out, AND bus tables).  The chef is extremely nice.  The last time I dined in, the chef stopped by every patron's table to ensure that the food was to our liking, which it ABSOLUTELY was!  I had the truffle burger, which was juicy and delicious.  My friend ordered the cajun seafood pasta, which was definitely worth it, as it was packed with shrimps and other yumminess.  The food is not light so be ready to loosen your belt, but it is all delicious.  I don't usually like cash only restaurants, but this place is priced reasonably so it doesn't bother me.  I LOVE, LOVE, LOVE Juniper.  GO NOW!

This place was a total surprise. I've seen it many times while passing by, but for some reason I never decided to get in. The other day we couldn't find a place to have brunch and Juniper was the only restaurant with a table for us. So we gave it a try.. and so happy that we did!First off, the food is delicious. I tried the pulled pork sandwich and I tell you, it was the best I've ever had. The place is charming, the atmosphere relaxed, so unlike the other restaurants in the area. We could talk to each other with no need of screaming. It felt like we were some place in NOLA instead of in the middle of hipster Williamsburg. Pleasant experience. I highly recommend this place

Came here for the first time recently because of the good reviews on Yelp. As others have said, yes, the place is small and a bit dark inside, but the food is delicious. My boyfriend and I both ordered burgers and shared the mac and cheese. The burger was very well-seasoned, and the mac and cheese was one of the best I've ever had... Huge portion too! The owners were nice, and gladly answered any questions we had about the menu. Although it's cash only, they do have an ATM in the back (although it was broken when we went). Also, others mentioned the long wait for their food, but our wait time was pretty standard.My boyfriend asked me when are we going back there, so I guess it was a hit for both of us!

Was looking forward to trying the food that had such great reviews... To my surprise my friends and I arrived at 1245 to a closed establishment. The website and app both reflected "noon" opening. Update your operational hours please!

Came here because of the glowing reviews and it's proximity to movie theater. So many trendy burger places out there so I have to be a little strict with the review. Very hard to be different but this is probably the first Asian hipster burger joint I've seen. Consider that market cornered. Read about their truffle burger so I ordered it with welcome additions of cheddar and bacon. Anything with truffles is really expensive so I became a little suspicious when the burger price was set at fifteen bucks and their other burgers are around twelve. I've seen the 60 Minutes investigative piece on Chinese truffles trying to be passed off for authentic French truffles so the price drop was not hard to figure out. Either way, truffles or no truffles, the burger really didn't knock my socks off. At least the sweet potato fries that came with burger were great. Having to wait about an hour to get our food was the real issue we had with this place. Thankfully, our movie didn't start til much later so we had time. To their credit, both the waitress and the cook came over to apologize for the wait so I have to cut them some slack for that. Unfortunately, I think this highly rated establishment along with a lot of others in the area are handicapped by the "hipster effect" on the review barometer.

Love this place!  My friend brought me here for a late lunch.  I got the catfish sandwich and it was delicious!  Tom - the owner of this wonderful establishment - was filling in for his waitress.  He was great company and his restaurant is the embodiment of what a New York mom and pop restaurant should be.  Great food, large portions, affordable, hospitable, and great conversation.  I will come back again soon!

Juniper is a small, intimate restaurant in the heart of hopping Williamsburg. It is byob (small beer and coring fee on the weekend), so come prepared.  The food is aways delicious! There is a garden in the back, open in the warmer months.  The chef is friendly and the atmosphere is warm and cozy. This place is guaranteed to satisfy the most picky of palattes!

This place is amazing. Honestly the best burger I've had in all of NYC (I say this because there is a great burger joint in Manhattan but this place is the best in the 5 boroughs). I try to come here once every couple of weeks to get a burger, either the Truffle or Chorizo Burger, with Spicy Fries. There Sweet Potato Fries are good as well. However the only problem is that because their burgers are so good I haven't had the chance to try out many other items on their menu. I just recently had their Jambalaya and you know what... it's also really good! Their Jambalaya is LOADED with shrimp, sausage, mussel, and chicken. Personally though, for anyone coming here for the first time, I would highly suggest to get the Truffle or Chorizo burger. It is honestly the juiciest, tastiest, and well cooked burger I've ever had.

Came here with the miss, wasn't super hungry so split the catfish sandwich with the spicy fries. One of the best catfish sandwiches I've had, super crispy and not oily. The spicy fries are also seasoned to perfection, and perfectly crispy as well! Oh yeah, cash only. There is an Atm inside in the back!

This place is awesome.  We had the seafood  past and it was delicious.  Catfish sandwich was great as well and their spicy fries are the best in the neighborhood!  Oh and did I mention it was BYOB.  What's not to like?

The food is always tasty here.  Service is excellent, especially if you get the young man who whizzes around doing everything (greet, take orders, bring food out, AND bus tables).  The chef is extremely nice.  The last time I dined in, the chef stopped by every patron's table to ensure that the food was to our liking, which it ABSOLUTELY was!  I had the truffle burger, which was juicy and delicious.  My friend ordered the cajun seafood pasta, which was definitely worth it, as it was packed with shrimps and other yumminess.  The food is not light so be ready to loosen your belt, but it is all delicious.  I don't usually like cash only restaurants, but this place is priced reasonably so it doesn't bother me.  I LOVE, LOVE, LOVE Juniper.  GO NOW!

We could talk to each other with no need of screaming. It felt like we were some place in NOLA instead of in the middle of hipster Williamsburg. Pleasant experience. I highly recommend this place

The spicy fries are also seasoned to perfection, and perfectly crispy as well! Oh yeah, cash only. There is an Atm inside in the back!

This place is awesome.  We had the seafood  past and it was delicious.  Catfish sandwich was great as well and their spicy fries are the best in the neighborhood!  Oh and did I mention it was BYOB.  What's not to like?
Yum yum yumtown. Try the truffle or pulled pork burger. So damn good. Also, it's BYO and is kind to your wallet. Make sure to bring cash as they don't accept credit cards.
Rib sandwich with sweet potato fries were awesome. Shared chicken tenders which were also yummy.  Friendly and attentive staff.

amazing. amazing. amazing.Juniper has certainly become one of my favorite restaurants. It never disappoints. The food is absolutely delicious. My boyfriend and I visit frequently and always end up ordering the same thing. Their chicken fingers (yummy), their pulled pork sliders (probably the best I've ever had), and their baked mac and cheese (which is pure perfection). The greatest part, is that the bill is always $25 dollars, quite the bargain. Also it's BYOB, who doesn't love that. The staff is also super friendly. So if you're ever in the area and in need of some delicious food, look no further.

This place wasn't that noticeable when passing by, actually found it on yelp. This was a cute little spot and I loved that they had a spacious backyard area where you can sit and eat. The waiter and waitress were very friendly. The food was so delicious and my boyfriend, sister and brother-in-law all loved their food. It was also BYOB which was pretty cool because I've never been to somewhere like that. I loved the service and food!

Super glad I walked in the rain to get to this place. Ordered the grilled burger & spicy fries. The cook even came out to personally ask how we liked our food & of course it was cooked to perfection. The service was great! Pretty chill spot to enjoy a delicious burger. Came in feeling hungover but now I'm off to do some shopping!

Atmosphere was very rustic, beautiful 1920's era cash register (Bring Cash) behind the bar (BYOB). Staff was very friendly, food was absolutely awesome. Great BBQ Wings, Pulled Pork to die for. Great Price! Well Done Juniper, Well Done!

My friends and I were craving burgers and came across this spot super close to the Brooklyn Brewery. The baked mac and cheese was literally the greatest thing I've tasted in my life! My friend had the fish and chips which was huge and cooked to perfection, the burger was pretty great too! The guys that worked there were extremely friendly, the owner was very cool and fun to talk to as well. I'm definitely coming back asap! P.S: everything people have said about the spicy fries is true! Perfect amount of Cajun seasoning!

I went on a lazy Sunday before Memorial Day and was pleasantly surprised :)!  The linguine with shrimp drew me in and honestly I was expecting wrinkled shrimp with random linguine and half the amount of olive oil needed for the dish.  What I got was fresh and plump shrimp with perfectly cooked linguine in a soupy white wine and garlic sauce.  Yes I said soupy and that's what made the dish so unique!  I had to speak to the chef and when I met Tom he told me that he had worked in the real Little Italy of Manhattan and learned his methods there.  He prefers to have a neighborhood restaurant instead of a chain and all I can say is that he really knows what he's doing!
One of my favorite places! You can't go wrong with pretty much everything on the menu. Truffle Burger is a personal favorite.

My goodness. The truffle burger and the spicy tries are terrific. It's a small cozy place with delightful service. Expect a wait for the food and try not go catch then on a busy night. 4 stars and not five because I asked for medium rare and got medium instead. Solid place to go to. Would absolutely recommend.
Yum yum yumtown. Try the truffle or pulled pork burger. So damn good. Also, it's BYO and is kind to your wallet. Make sure to bring cash as they don't accept credit cards.
Rib sandwich with sweet potato fries were awesome. Shared chicken tenders which were also yummy.  Friendly and attentive staff.

The service was great! Pretty chill spot to enjoy a delicious burger. Came in feeling hungover but now I'm off to do some shopping!

P.S: everything people have said about the spicy fries is true! Perfect amount of Cajun seasoning!

One of my favorite places! You can't go wrong with pretty much everything on the menu. Truffle Burger is a personal favorite.

My goodness. The truffle burger and the spicy tries are terrific. It's a small cozy place with delightful service. Expect a wait for the food and try not go catch then on a busy night. 4 stars and not five because I asked for medium rare and got medium instead. Solid place to go to. Would absolutely recommend.

If I could choose the way to die, I would probably opt for a heart attack after the pulled pork sandwich and the sweet potato fries at this place. I have been blessed by living across the street of this cozy, unpretentious restaurant that features very good food, kind management and fine art hanging on the walls. One star less because it's only cash.
The food was awesome, I had the truffle burger, so delicious. And the staff was so friendly and personal.
Consistently Fantastic!Everything

The food was amazing! Very old school and small (biggest table is 4-6 people). Cash only. My sister loved the seafood jambalaya. I originally chose this place because I wanted a burger and the pot pie would suit my sister. Little did I know I LOVED the pot pie (barely even finish it cause it was so big) and we took the leftover jambalaya home. It was the perfect amount of spicy with seafood. Shrimps were clean (It's a big deal for my sister!) The waitress was friendly, attentive, and gave us space to chat! The pot pie was fresh, straight out of the oven, and perfectly seasoned. I will definitely be going back!

NOTE: THIS PLACE WAS NOT SHUT DOWN DUE TO HEALTH VIOLATIONS. I talked to the owner and they forgot to renew their license to serve food, but should be back up by the weekend. It all had to do with insurance, no sanitation problems. Notice the A in the window.But seriously, I've been coming here at least once a week for 2 years now and it never gets old. The burgers, the soups, the pulled pork, ALL OF IT IS YUMMY. It tastes like family cooking. You can tell this guy is really passionate about what he does. He will take the time to come out and ask you how your food was and how you are. It's BYOB and I LOVE that, but be nice and don't disrespect it! I've seen many a highschooler coming here with "water bottles" getting wasted in the backyard. This is not your parents' basement, this is a respectable establishment! I've been told they want to add desserts to the menu, so give this guy your business! He needs it after being shut down for a few days.

I loved it here!  This is a nice close knit group of people running this business and they show how much they care.  The cook came out and talked to make customers and made sure they all loved their food... Which I did. I got the steak and cheese sandwich.  It was huge!!! and delicious.  I also got the spicy fries which were also good but, they are spicy as their name says, not just spiced.  My husband got a burger and said it was very good as well and he devoured it.  We also got chicken tenders as an appetizer to split.  They were very crunchy and moist.  The servings here are large and you will not leave hungry.  They recently started selling alcoholic beverages but they still do not take credit, cash only.
Super burgers, super service, it was a very nice lunch break in our journey ! We will come back asap

Cute little burger joint. The truffle burger was wonderful- was medium rare as I ordered it and great flavor. I should have read the reviews more carefully- I didn't know it's BYOB but will be sure to bring something next time!The macaroni and cheese was slightly disappointing. It lacked any seasoning whatsoever... Looked amazing though.
This place is closed for permitting issues but they don't have a message up on the VM or on their website. Don't waist your time walking here like we did last night.

Love this place. Not sure why people make a big deal about it being a hole in the wall. I've had some of the best food from hole in the wall joints. Besides, this place is clean just really small. They make the best pulled pork sandwich in Brooklyn. The meat is not overly smoked which I like and is cured very well. Smothered in an amazing house made sauce which gives the sandwich a real kick. Really flavorful. The jambalaya and the rib steak sandwich are amazing as well. Oh and the food comes with a side of fries. Both the sweet potato and and cajun are great.

One star less because it's only cash.

They make the best pulled pork sandwich in Brooklyn. The meat is not overly smoked which I like and is cured very well. Smothered in an amazing house made sauce which gives the sandwich a real kick. Really flavorful. The jambalaya and the rib steak sandwich are amazing as well. Oh and the food comes with a side of fries. Both the sweet potato and and cajun are great.

The Burger has been perfected!!!! The girlfriend and I were in the neighborhood and I have been wanting to go to this place for a while so we said why not. It was a Saturday evening and at first we wondered why we were the only ones in the restaurant, but as other patrons walked in and asked to be seated in the back we learned that the place had a back area. We kind of wised we were given the option to sit in the back but inside was just fine. The food is made to order so expect to wait a while for your meal. It's also BYOB. Both waiters were really nice and personable, they held small talk with us and this place definitely has a family feeling to it. On to the food.... Slamming!!! My girlfriend had the Truffel burger and I had the regular. This place has perfected the burger in such a way that cannot be described with words. Even the fries are excellent. I will be sure to return.

I've been having a burger craving for a really long time and I came here after the oyster happy hour at Maison Premiere (which is btw GREAT!).Got the truffle burger with gouda, medium rare - taste was good and cooked perfectly.  Nom.  Was totally a fan.Friends got the grilled burger.  They also enjoyed it =)Shared the Spicy fries and the sweet potato fries.  Both were delish!  Apparently you can request spicy sweet potato fries - the perfect combo! Wish we knew about that earlier.  So try ordering that next time! =)

This is a really cute place. My brother and I came here after searching for a good lunch place in BK. He and I both got the pulled pork which was so good. I pretty much always get pulled pork if it's on the menu. He got the sandwich and I got the sliders. The sauce on the sandwiches is different from sauce I've had before. It was a little spicy and tangy but it was great. We came here right after they opened on a Saturday. It was pretty dead even though the waiter seemed a little preoccupied. It was kind of annoying since we knew what we wanted to eat and drink just a few minutes after sitting down. If I were walking near here in the future, I'd probably stop in.
Came here on sunday afternoon. ordered truffle burger with sweet potato fries and my bf got chorizo burger with spicy fries. Both were delicious. Definitely coming back again soon. :)

BYOB, some of the best fries I have ever had, awesome shrimp and chicken and kick ass tunes - this place is a great spot to bring out of towners who want a different dining experience. Our meals were delicious and the staff couldn't have been more eager to please. I absolutely love this place.

Juniper came up as a search result as my friend and I explored Williamsburg. There were too many small restaurants we just couldn't choose, so we left it up to Yelp (and we happened to pass it at that exact moment). Even though there are 4 stars, there weren't that many people here on a late Saturday afternoon. My friend and I soon became the only patrons of this restaurant. Service was very friendly! Opting for something light, I got the Cajun shrimp salad. I love salads that are heavily doused in dressing. The tarteness of the balsamic vinegar dressing was a great contrast to the savory grilled shrimp. My friend ordered the fish and chips and out came a 12-inch piece of fish--the biggest I've ever seen. It looked greasy, but it didn't taste oily at all. The fish fell off in flakes, and a few dashes of malt vinegar was all you need. The fries that went with her dish were also delicious, I highly recommend that as a side order to whatever you decide to eat at Juniper. I will definitely come back here again if I feel like venturing to Williamsburg.

I do not know where to start. We walk in on a Saturday, was not greeted so we just found a spot and sat. After about 15 mins i asked for a menu, and thats all i got. Then after a few more mins asked for some water. Thats all i got. Finally we got our order taken after i flagged someone down. She took it and thats all i got. After about 40 mins we got our food, i ordered the pulled pork sandwich it was good, the sweet potato fries were burnt and horrible. My friend got the bbq boneless rib sandwich i think, she said it was ok and didnt even finish it tough were were starving from waiting so long. OH and mind you i had to ask for silver ware once we got our food. Not sure if it was just too busy for them but yet i didnt look busy or was it that we were not yuppies or looked like them? I only say that because bunch of tables with parties far larger then ours (ours being me and one other person) got there food and drinks and whatever before us and arrived long after us. Juniper could be good but my experience was not one that would ever have me going back or recommend this place to anyone.If it wasn't that I am 8 months pregnant, starving and have not been out for a short while, we would have up and just left.This is not a place for me.

I came in for lunch yesterday and walked in to find the place empty.  I was a bit confused until the nice women at the counter asked 'how many'?.  I said it would just be me and she offered a table in their back patio, since it was such a nice day.  Once I was out back, I realized THAT'S where all of the customers were!I ordered a shrimp linguine pasta and enjoyed the warm sun and cool breeze.The food took a bit of time to come out, but was well worth it.  The pasta was tender and swimming in a delicious white wine and garlic sauce.  The shrimp were big and juicy and seasoned just right.  I noticed they had other southern comfort foods on their menu (mac & cheese, catfish poboys, jambalaya, etc) so I am definitely coming back to try out the rest of their menu.  After my meal, my waitress (the woman who greeted me earlier) and her husband asked how I liked my meal.  I chatted with them a bit about my recent move and the weather and it was really nice to talk to local business owners (and the person who made my delicious food!).  If you are in the neighborhood, try out this place.  Good luck trying to figure out what to order, though.  There are too many good choices!

I really enjoyed a lunch in a very relaxed garden. In comparison with other Wsburg outside patios where often the buzzing sound of air conditioner just kills any benefit of being outside, here the outside garden is just tranquil. Add to that a really tasty cooked to perfection burger for just $11... And you've got yourself one of the best lunches this summer (so far).

A sane spot on crazy Berry St that's BYOB with a wine shop across the street.  The burgers are really good and their other dishes are up to par.  Had truffle burger and the jambalaya.  Both dericious!  Their spicy fries are great booze fodder.  The real thing that set this place apart is that the tables aren't squeezed together and you have breathing room with good, no frills food with prompt, attentive service.  In Williamsburg on a weekend night, that's a notable premium!

The Burger has been perfected!!!! The girlfriend and I were in the neighborhood and I have been wanting to go to this place for a while so we said why not. It was a Saturday evening and at first we wondered why we were the only ones in the restaurant, but as other patrons walked in and asked to be seated in the back we learned that the place had a back area. We kind of wised we were given the option to sit in the back but inside was just fine. The food is made to order so expect to wait a while for your meal. It's also BYOB. Both waiters were really nice and personable, they held small talk with us and this place definitely has a family feeling to it. On to the food.... Slamming!!! My girlfriend had the Truffel burger and I had the regular. This place has perfected the burger in such a way that cannot be described with words. Even the fries are excellent. I will be sure to return.

I've been having a burger craving for a really long time and I came here after the oyster happy hour at Maison Premiere (which is btw GREAT!).Got the truffle burger with gouda, medium rare - taste was good and cooked perfectly.  Nom.  Was totally a fan.Friends got the grilled burger.  They also enjoyed it =)Shared the Spicy fries and the sweet potato fries.  Both were delish!  Apparently you can request spicy sweet potato fries - the perfect combo! Wish we knew about that earlier.  So try ordering that next time! =)

This is a really cute place. My brother and I came here after searching for a good lunch place in BK. He and I both got the pulled pork which was so good. I pretty much always get pulled pork if it's on the menu. He got the sandwich and I got the sliders. The sauce on the sandwiches is different from sauce I've had before. It was a little spicy and tangy but it was great. We came here right after they opened on a Saturday. It was pretty dead even though the waiter seemed a little preoccupied. It was kind of annoying since we knew what we wanted to eat and drink just a few minutes after sitting down. If I were walking near here in the future, I'd probably stop in.
Came here on sunday afternoon. ordered truffle burger with sweet potato fries and my bf got chorizo burger with spicy fries. Both were delicious. Definitely coming back again soon. :)

BYOB, some of the best fries I have ever had, awesome shrimp and chicken and kick ass tunes - this place is a great spot to bring out of towners who want a different dining experience. Our meals were delicious and the staff couldn't have been more eager to please. I absolutely love this place.

Juniper came up as a search result as my friend and I explored Williamsburg. There were too many small restaurants we just couldn't choose, so we left it up to Yelp (and we happened to pass it at that exact moment). Even though there are 4 stars, there weren't that many people here on a late Saturday afternoon. My friend and I soon became the only patrons of this restaurant. Service was very friendly! Opting for something light, I got the Cajun shrimp salad. I love salads that are heavily doused in dressing. The tarteness of the balsamic vinegar dressing was a great contrast to the savory grilled shrimp. My friend ordered the fish and chips and out came a 12-inch piece of fish--the biggest I've ever seen. It looked greasy, but it didn't taste oily at all. The fish fell off in flakes, and a few dashes of malt vinegar was all you need. The fries that went with her dish were also delicious, I highly recommend that as a side order to whatever you decide to eat at Juniper. I will definitely come back here again if I feel like venturing to Williamsburg.

I do not know where to start. We walk in on a Saturday, was not greeted so we just found a spot and sat. After about 15 mins i asked for a menu, and thats all i got. Then after a few more mins asked for some water. Thats all i got. Finally we got our order taken after i flagged someone down. She took it and thats all i got. After about 40 mins we got our food, i ordered the pulled pork sandwich it was good, the sweet potato fries were burnt and horrible. My friend got the bbq boneless rib sandwich i think, she said it was ok and didnt even finish it tough were were starving from waiting so long. OH and mind you i had to ask for silver ware once we got our food. Not sure if it was just too busy for them but yet i didnt look busy or was it that we were not yuppies or looked like them? I only say that because bunch of tables with parties far larger then ours (ours being me and one other person) got there food and drinks and whatever before us and arrived long after us. Juniper could be good but my experience was not one that would ever have me going back or recommend this place to anyone.If it wasn't that I am 8 months pregnant, starving and have not been out for a short while, we would have up and just left.This is not a place for me.

I came in for lunch yesterday and walked in to find the place empty.  I was a bit confused until the nice women at the counter asked 'how many'?.  I said it would just be me and she offered a table in their back patio, since it was such a nice day.  Once I was out back, I realized THAT'S where all of the customers were!I ordered a shrimp linguine pasta and enjoyed the warm sun and cool breeze.The food took a bit of time to come out, but was well worth it.  The pasta was tender and swimming in a delicious white wine and garlic sauce.  The shrimp were big and juicy and seasoned just right.  I noticed they had other southern comfort foods on their menu (mac & cheese, catfish poboys, jambalaya, etc) so I am definitely coming back to try out the rest of their menu.  After my meal, my waitress (the woman who greeted me earlier) and her husband asked how I liked my meal.  I chatted with them a bit about my recent move and the weather and it was really nice to talk to local business owners (and the person who made my delicious food!).  If you are in the neighborhood, try out this place.  Good luck trying to figure out what to order, though.  There are too many good choices!

I really enjoyed a lunch in a very relaxed garden. In comparison with other Wsburg outside patios where often the buzzing sound of air conditioner just kills any benefit of being outside, here the outside garden is just tranquil. Add to that a really tasty cooked to perfection burger for just $11... And you've got yourself one of the best lunches this summer (so far).

A sane spot on crazy Berry St that's BYOB with a wine shop across the street.  The burgers are really good and their other dishes are up to par.  Had truffle burger and the jambalaya.  Both dericious!  Their spicy fries are great booze fodder.  The real thing that set this place apart is that the tables aren't squeezed together and you have breathing room with good, no frills food with prompt, attentive service.  In Williamsburg on a weekend night, that's a notable premium!

MMM... this place is delicious and I highly recommend it for some good old, no nonsense food. It's tiny and cozy, but no frills here. Get a burger - it's so juicy and perfectly cooked. The fries are crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside. If you want something a little different, go for the spicy fries.If you're looking for a low key spot for a couple of friends or a simple date, this is the place.

Cute lil local burger joint that is BYOB! If you forgot your beer, there is a deli across the street a few doors down :]I got the truffle burger w/gargonzola & spicy fries. I saw from other yelpers that the "spicy fries" came in criss-cut form, however when my fries came out, they were just regular fries, no criss cut :[The burger was alright. I wouldnt say it was amazing, but it was good. The patty was thick, the buns were brioche. They cooked it medium rare per my request. The lil asian lady, I think was maybe an owner or something, she was super nice and very attentive.

I'm about to go on a lengthy rant about authenticity. If you're not intrigued by my idiocy and are only interested in reading about Juniper, please skip to the paragraph that starts, "What I'm trying to say..."There's a lot of talk in the food community* about this thing they call "authenticity." For instance, I've met people that will dismiss restaurants out of hand simply based on the nationality of the owners/chefs: "I don't care if it's good, I refuse to eat that pad kee mao unless I see the chef's long-form Thai birth certificate."Disagree if you'd like, but I am not that concerned about whether or not food is "authentic." Deliciousness is what matters. I don't care if a Chinese guy is back there making my sushi...I don't care if these tacos were made by a white guy...I don't care if a Puerto Rican** made this pho...I don't care if a Mexican is making my pizza......as long as they are doing it RIGHT, and it tastes GOOD. Of course, oftentimes a Mexican guy is going to make the best tacos and so forth. That's all well and good, but just make sure to keep an open mind. We are fortunate enough to live in an age when virtually anyone can learn the proper techniques/recipes, and virtually anyone can gain access to product from all around the world. There is no way that you can convince me that one person is AUTOMATICALLY better at doing something, simply by virtue of where he or she was born.***What I'm trying to say in a roundabout, absurdly tangential way, is that Juniper's chef might be of Asian descent, but that in no way prevents him from cooking up some DELICIOUS "American" food. Bottom line: he knows what he's doing when it comes to unhealthy things that make your mouth water. The burgers are big and beautiful, actually cooked to order and served on a fluffy brioche roll that soaks up all the juicy goodness. The spicy fries (while not very spicy), are waffle fries, so they are obviously amazing. The mac & cheese is heart attack good. But it's the BBQ Short Rib sandwich that stole my heart. Sure, Jane was the one who ordered it, but she couldn't even finish half because this thing is PILED HIGH with saucy ribs. I am in love. Thank god Jane's a tiny little woman who was willing to share [after I ripped it out of her hands].Juniper might not look like much, and the service could be better, but if you are looking for some bar-type food, they do it right. ___________*A prime example: dinersjournal.blogs.nyti…**Unless it was my boy Javi, because that scumbag would probably spit in it if he knew it was for me. ***Except perhaps when it comes to Kenyans and long distance running. But that's a question of altitude.

Juniper was a lovely lunch haven during my recent trip to NY. A haven because while it's definitely small, it's also quaint and polite and I didn't feel at all as though I was being rushed in and out so that my table could be turned as many times as possible. Perhaps the difference between eating lunch and eating dinner or maybe it's the difference between eating in Manhattan and eating in Brooklyn. I don't know. But, I do know that I enjoyed the fact that it felt like the restaurant wanted me there for as long as I wanted to be there. (Which, by the way was under an hour. I mean it's lunch time you know?)The exposed brick insides and chalk menus reminded me of some of my favorite spots in Denver and the menu itself reminded me of my delicious childhood in the South with a fancy touch at times. Things like the mac and cheese should be devoured. Things like the burgers should be savored, especially if it's truffled. Things like the waffles fries should be at all restaurants that serve any kind of fries. (What is it about waffling that makes a fry so much better? I may never know...)This spot is cash only so be prepared for that. And when I say they didn't rush us I also mean they were slow to take our order or bring our check so don't go if you're in a hurry or an impatient person in general. Or if you do go at least be prepared for this. All in all if I lived anywhere near this spot you'd probably see my mug on the regulars check-in board here because it was a damn fine experience.

Picture a rainy day and all I want to do is curl up with a book and nest. That worked until my stomach said it was time to eat and there's nothing to munch on in the apartment. Hmm, got out my Yelp app to see what I can find in the neighborhood.What a gem I discovered just a few blocks away. Everything sounded good but I settled on Mac n Cheese to go.The service was very gracious as I waited for my order which was freshly made and  baked. I chatted with a couple of other diners who sang praises for their lunchtime offerings. This cozy spot had a true following and I deemed it well earned as I forked into my comfort food at home. I ate this one order 2 days in a row, still leaving behind  leftover when I jetted home to CA.I will return on my next visit to work my way down the menu.

Excellent experience all round. The grilled burger was cooked medium rare as requested and was delicious. The price was very reasonable and the service was very friendly. Will definitely eat here again.
Best damn slow roasted BBQ sandwhich this side of the Tallahassee! I luv every single entree here! BYOB. Greatest chef and very friendly staff

A Williamsburg Gem! Best Southern inspired restaurant I've had since living in NYC. My boyfriend and I are both from the south and very critical of spots that claim to serve comfort food. Let me tell you - the food is PERFECTION! The catfish sandwich is battered and seasoned exactly like I would find at home. The BBQ Rib Sandwich is the most tender I've ever had and the coleslaw on the side is a perfect touch. The Jambalaya wow'ed my New Orleans native boyfriend and he is very particular when others dare to make this meal. The burger is delicious, yet I think you are playing it way too safe if you get this. Try something you can't get somewhere else.Housekeeping: The food is always hot. Portions are huge. BYOB. There is a cute seating area in the backyard. And the owner's passion in making delicious food is clear with every dish you'll try!

My date and I sat at the bar and shared an order of the sliders and the pulled pork sliders.  Each order comes with 2 sliders.  Surprisingly, I liked the regular sliders better but both were just awesome.  It's BYO, which we didn't have, but was a great fuel station before a show at the Music Hall of Williamsburg.  We'd definitely come back here if in the area.  Cash only, so come prepared.

If budget was no option, but I could only eat at one restaurant for the rest of my life, I would choose Juniper.Everything about this place is amazing. Best wings in NYC, the Chicken Ceasar has the most tender chicken I have ever had, truffle burger melts in your mouth, and the chef himself (an avid snowboarder, i learned) comes out to make sure everyone is having a good time.Please exist forever!!!

MMM... this place is delicious and I highly recommend it for some good old, no nonsense food. It's tiny and cozy, but no frills here. Get a burger - it's so juicy and perfectly cooked. The fries are crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside. If you want something a little different, go for the spicy fries.If you're looking for a low key spot for a couple of friends or a simple date, this is the place.

I wouldnt say it was amazing, but it was good. The patty was thick, the buns were brioche. They cooked it medium rare per my request. The lil asian lady, I think was maybe an owner or something, she was super nice and very attentive.

Excellent experience all round. The grilled burger was cooked medium rare as requested and was delicious. The price was very reasonable and the service was very friendly. Will definitely eat here again.
Best damn slow roasted BBQ sandwhich this side of the Tallahassee! I luv every single entree here! BYOB. Greatest chef and very friendly staff

The burger is delicious, yet I think you are playing it way too safe if you get this. Try something you can't get somewhere else.Housekeeping: The food is always hot. Portions are huge. BYOB.
