If budget was no option, but I could only eat at one restaurant for the rest of my life, I would choose Juniper.Everything about this place is amazing. Best wings in NYC, the Chicken Ceasar has the most tender chicken I have ever had, truffle burger melts in your mouth, and the chef himself (an avid snowboarder, i learned) comes out to make sure everyone is having a good time.Please exist forever!!!

Great service and amazing food! I had the classic bacon cheeseburger and it was one of the best burgers I've ever had. It was moist and cooked to perfection. My son had mac and cheese with bacon and loved it. The chef came out of the kitchen to ask if we liked our food. Pretty amazing experience!Definitely recommend this place!

Ok....first off, this restaurant is HALF a step away from a fast food burger chain. I just so happen to be in the area looking for a good burger joint for me and my gf to eat at. I checked yelp and saw all these great reviews and decided to check it out. Upon arrival I knew that I was duped by my fellow yelp citizens. As I sat down and gazed at the menu I was distracted by the overwhelming cold draft of air that was circulating around the room. THE ABSCENSE of heat really made it hard for me and my company to enjoy ourselves. The shorten this review I have decided to take a bullet style approach :Cons--No Heat-High School Cafe Menu-I tried to order hot wings as an appetizer and was told they "RAN OUT"..(really    though!!)-I Asked for a Sierra Mist and they gave me 75 cent can of Sierra Mist!!! lol -Fries were tooo salty -Cash Only Pros-Mussels were excellent and tasty-Burger was decent although they overpowered the burger I ordered by putting too much gorgonzola cheese. ( must be careful with that type of cheese!)- Fries were too- The chef actually delivered the food and asked how everything was at the end of the meal! REAL CLASSY IMO.Only recommend this spot for people looking for a quick quick meal. Without the service of selling mussels this place is looked at in my eyes as a half a step above in quality than five guys

Juniper is a Williamsburg staple. This is the kind of place that makes a neighborhood.The chef (maybe owner too?) Tom hangs out in the front of house all the time and he will share all his techniques with you if you ask. He is so friendly and inviting and makes you feel like you came to see him so he can cook just for you.Prices are totally reasonable for the quality of food. The wings are insanely good time and time again and the Mac and cheese is hearty as you could hope for.It is BYOB, though, so keep that in mind. They're super cool with getting you glasses and they don't charge to open your bottle of wine. It's not hard to grab a box of wine on N8/Driggs and go to town, though.I love this place and I'll be coming back for as long as they're around.
I was shocked that this hipsterish cafe serves the best burger and fries in Brooklyn. Try it, you'll like it!

This is a fantastic quality eatery in the Williamsburg neighborhood. Every time I visit, the food is outstanding and staff is awesome. Menu is smaller but perfected. Everything is prepared daily and fresh. I am not one to take time for reviews but this place is well deserved. Best Pulled pork sandwich I've ever had and Ive had plentyyyy of others. Check it out asap!

I ordered one and only one thing here, the jambalaya, and it was some of the best I've ever tasted. (and I've lived in New Orleans and on the gulf coast for 3.5 years)It's definitely not a fine-dining establishment, and to be honest the server could have paid a little more attention to my water glass, but it was still very good and I left very happy about my experience here.

We came here for lunch on Sunday. I had the catfish burger here with the spicy (cajun) fries, and my friend had their grilled burger with sweet potato fries - both were delicious! The restaurant wasn't very busy when we came, so we had very good service. The chef/owner even came out and exchanged a few words with us to make sure that we were enjoying our meals. Overall it was a great experience!

GOD DAMN. HOLY SHIT.JUST...WOW.Juniper is beyond amazing. There are just no words to describe how I felt when I dined here the other day. I have no complaints!Come here for the...1. FRIENDLY SERVICE - The waitress and the owner will come by and ask you your opinion, but not in an annoying way at all. In fact, you won't want them to leave because you'll have so many positive things to express to them.2. TOM - The owner alone is a damn good reason to come here. You can tell he is extremely passionate about what he does. He is a genuinely good person.3. ATMOSPHERE - Very casual. Totally unpretentious. A great place to relax and stuff your belly.4. PATIO - Could seat about 6 groups!5. CHICKEN TENDERS - You just have to try it. Chicken tenders battered in rice krispies. It is well worth the $6...but for now, you can get it for free (or any other appetizers) when you get 2 entrees and mention Yelp! It comes with BBQ or honey mustard. It was delicious with both.6. BURGERS - First of all it doesn't just taste amazing but it looks amazing. It looked like it was ready to be photographed for a food magazine or something. 7. BURGER BUNS - They use brioche, which is a very pleasant change from regular buns. It's sweet and goes so well with the burger. It just looks prettier too.8. CATFISH SANDWICH - Best catfish sandwich I've ever had. Perfect amount of tartar sauce...and once again, served on brioche. 9. FRIES - The fries came with the burger and sandwich. You get a choice of french fries, sweet potato fries, or spicy fries. The sweet potato fries will shock you at first because it's almost like you're eating air...but I mean that in a good way. The spicy fries are in waffle shapes and was perfectly crispy.10. Location - One block from the Bedford Ave L train stop, on Berry St. Very convenient, yet away from all the chaos. If my list doesn't entice you to dine here, there is something very wrong with you.

Came here with my friends for a birthday celebration. Food was great once again. I would try the catfish sandwich and jambalaya next time!!! My friend ordered the pulled pork sandwich but it was in marinated with a spicy BBQ sauce so my friend couldn't really handle it. The mussel sauce was a bit salty. But I will still be back. We all had a great time!

We chose this place because of the high review on yelp . We went this afternoon and the place was so empty,only one table customer,maybe some in the backyard,for sure they are not busy!We ordered BBQ rib sandwich and grill sandwich from a woman!After 20-30minutes,we were still waiting for our food! I finally asked the woman how long we should keep waiting, she told me another 15-20minutes! Wtf! I am sure she or the staff in the kitchen skipped or forgot our order! We decided to leave without any food! BTW,at least 3 flys flying in the restaurant,I wonder if the food there is clean enough! The service is not attentive,I saw a customer coming from backyard to ask for the ice water on a hot summer day! I will not give any star if possible on yelp!

Great service and amazing food! I had the classic bacon cheeseburger and it was one of the best burgers I've ever had. It was moist and cooked to perfection. My son had mac and cheese with bacon and loved it. The chef came out of the kitchen to ask if we liked our food. Pretty amazing experience!Definitely recommend this place!

Ok....first off, this restaurant is HALF a step away from a fast food burger chain. I just so happen to be in the area looking for a good burger joint for me and my gf to eat at. I checked yelp and saw all these great reviews and decided to check it out. Upon arrival I knew that I was duped by my fellow yelp citizens. As I sat down and gazed at the menu I was distracted by the overwhelming cold draft of air that was circulating around the room. THE ABSCENSE of heat really made it hard for me and my company to enjoy ourselves. The shorten this review I have decided to take a bullet style approach :Cons--No Heat-High School Cafe Menu-I tried to order hot wings as an appetizer and was told they "RAN OUT"..(really    though!!)-I Asked for a Sierra Mist and they gave me 75 cent can of Sierra Mist!!! lol -Fries were tooo salty -Cash Only Pros-Mussels were excellent and tasty-Burger was decent although they overpowered the burger I ordered by putting too much gorgonzola cheese. ( must be careful with that type of cheese!)- Fries were too- The chef actually delivered the food and asked how everything was at the end of the meal! REAL CLASSY IMO.Only recommend this spot for people looking for a quick quick meal. Without the service of selling mussels this place is looked at in my eyes as a half a step above in quality than five guys

Juniper is a Williamsburg staple. This is the kind of place that makes a neighborhood.The chef (maybe owner too?) Tom hangs out in the front of house all the time and he will share all his techniques with you if you ask. He is so friendly and inviting and makes you feel like you came to see him so he can cook just for you.Prices are totally reasonable for the quality of food. The wings are insanely good time and time again and the Mac and cheese is hearty as you could hope for.It is BYOB, though, so keep that in mind. They're super cool with getting you glasses and they don't charge to open your bottle of wine. It's not hard to grab a box of wine on N8/Driggs and go to town, though.I love this place and I'll be coming back for as long as they're around.
I was shocked that this hipsterish cafe serves the best burger and fries in Brooklyn. Try it, you'll like it!

This is a fantastic quality eatery in the Williamsburg neighborhood. Every time I visit, the food is outstanding and staff is awesome. Menu is smaller but perfected. Everything is prepared daily and fresh. I am not one to take time for reviews but this place is well deserved. Best Pulled pork sandwich I've ever had and Ive had plentyyyy of others. Check it out asap!

I ordered one and only one thing here, the jambalaya, and it was some of the best I've ever tasted. (and I've lived in New Orleans and on the gulf coast for 3.5 years)It's definitely not a fine-dining establishment, and to be honest the server could have paid a little more attention to my water glass, but it was still very good and I left very happy about my experience here.

We came here for lunch on Sunday. I had the catfish burger here with the spicy (cajun) fries, and my friend had their grilled burger with sweet potato fries - both were delicious! The restaurant wasn't very busy when we came, so we had very good service. The chef/owner even came out and exchanged a few words with us to make sure that we were enjoying our meals. Overall it was a great experience!

GOD DAMN. HOLY SHIT.JUST...WOW.Juniper is beyond amazing. There are just no words to describe how I felt when I dined here the other day. I have no complaints!Come here for the...1. FRIENDLY SERVICE - The waitress and the owner will come by and ask you your opinion, but not in an annoying way at all. In fact, you won't want them to leave because you'll have so many positive things to express to them.2. TOM - The owner alone is a damn good reason to come here. You can tell he is extremely passionate about what he does. He is a genuinely good person.3. ATMOSPHERE - Very casual. Totally unpretentious. A great place to relax and stuff your belly.4. PATIO - Could seat about 6 groups!5. CHICKEN TENDERS - You just have to try it. Chicken tenders battered in rice krispies. It is well worth the $6...but for now, you can get it for free (or any other appetizers) when you get 2 entrees and mention Yelp! It comes with BBQ or honey mustard. It was delicious with both.6. BURGERS - First of all it doesn't just taste amazing but it looks amazing. It looked like it was ready to be photographed for a food magazine or something. 7. BURGER BUNS - They use brioche, which is a very pleasant change from regular buns. It's sweet and goes so well with the burger. It just looks prettier too.8. CATFISH SANDWICH - Best catfish sandwich I've ever had. Perfect amount of tartar sauce...and once again, served on brioche. 9. FRIES - The fries came with the burger and sandwich. You get a choice of french fries, sweet potato fries, or spicy fries. The sweet potato fries will shock you at first because it's almost like you're eating air...but I mean that in a good way. The spicy fries are in waffle shapes and was perfectly crispy.10. Location - One block from the Bedford Ave L train stop, on Berry St. Very convenient, yet away from all the chaos. If my list doesn't entice you to dine here, there is something very wrong with you.

Came here with my friends for a birthday celebration. Food was great once again. I would try the catfish sandwich and jambalaya next time!!! My friend ordered the pulled pork sandwich but it was in marinated with a spicy BBQ sauce so my friend couldn't really handle it. The mussel sauce was a bit salty. But I will still be back. We all had a great time!

We chose this place because of the high review on yelp . We went this afternoon and the place was so empty,only one table customer,maybe some in the backyard,for sure they are not busy!We ordered BBQ rib sandwich and grill sandwich from a woman!After 20-30minutes,we were still waiting for our food! I finally asked the woman how long we should keep waiting, she told me another 15-20minutes! Wtf! I am sure she or the staff in the kitchen skipped or forgot our order! We decided to leave without any food! BTW,at least 3 flys flying in the restaurant,I wonder if the food there is clean enough! The service is not attentive,I saw a customer coming from backyard to ask for the ice water on a hot summer day! I will not give any star if possible on yelp!

Disappointing. I was in the neighborhood and went on Yelp to find the best burger nearby, and this popped up. For $13 ($14 with cheese, and $2 more if you want bacon), the medium rare burger I ordered came out well done. After waiting for over 45 minutes for it to come out, I was too hungry to send it back. Or waitress took two smoke breaks outside while we were there, and the table next to us was served two courses well before our food arrived (they had paid and left before our burgers came out), despite arriving at the same time. The remaining waitstaff didn't cover for our absentee waitress, so we asked to pay and were eventually given a check, but no one thought to come back to collect our cash (it's cash only). We asked to pay again, cash in hand, while our now-embarrassed waitress - who was apparently uncomfortable from watching this transpire, but not uncomfortable enough to put down her cigarette, come back inside, and finish doing her job - watched from afar. We forked over close to $40 for our mediocre charred and flavorless meat (habitually tipping 20%, even against our better judgment sometimes, as here) and left in a hurry, mumbling to ourselves that we were foolish not to have gone to River Styx or Esme, for far better burgers around the same price or cheaper. As you may have guessed, we won't be returning, and hopefully this review serves as a warning to others.

Ended up here by accident when I had some family in town. What a wonderful mistake! The food was killer! One of the best pork sandwiches I've ever had. The shrimp salad is super yummy too. The place is tiny, but we were there for lunch so it wasn't too cramped. Great food. Wish it wasn't byob though.
Best pulled pork sandwich in Williamsburg, hands down.  Better than Fette Sau, Mables, and Fatty Cue.  The big downsides are- it's BYOB,- they don't deliver, and- you have to pay cash.

Great pulled pork and great service at a great price.lI just went for the second time to Juniper with 2 friends. They were out of the rib sandwich so two of us had the pulled pork sandwich. It was fantastic! Meat was tender and moist, BBQ sauce was tasty (though not particularly creative), and the fries cooked perfectly. The other friend had the burger; she said it was good but not great. The total bill for us was under $40!

One of the best restaurants I've been to in NY!Their menu is simple, but the server was nice to answer all the questions we had. I loved how quaint Juniper was. You walk in.. and it was almost like walking into your friend's restaurant. Very laid back and welcoming.My friend and I stopped by Juniper to share an early dinner. We weren't starving, but we could definitely share a good dish, so we decided to check this place out.We shared the truffle burger with spicy fries.. and boy, this burger totally hit the spot for us both! It was juicy, packed with flavor, and absolutely delicious! Cooked just right with just the perfect amount of spices. The spicy fries (you can consider them to be cajun fries) were also poppin hot and delicious.The chef/owner (?) came out and asked how our food was. We ended up talking to him for a good thirty minutes before we headed out. He was SO laid back and hilarious. We talked about his experience growing up in NYC and his visit to LA (I'm from LA, so we shared some good laughs). I hope to see him again next time and compliment him once again on our wonderful but short experience.Damn... we should've ordered their mac `n cheese.

This is a place that we like to visit when we are in the area. Very casual setting but the food is very good. We ordered the rib sandwich and it was cooked perfectly with a good amount of BBQ sauce on it. We also had the linguini and shrimp which was very garlicy which I like but definitely need to share with your dinner partner so both of your breath smells like garlic! Always a good place to recommend in the area.

Monday night; the place was empty save for the guy on his laptop at the bar. BYOB; went across to get some wine and ordered the potpie. Took about 25-30 minutes but with fair warning. We weren't in any rush so my friend and I caught up and drank wine. No joke though, the owner/cook/waiter went out to get fresh veggies to put in our pot pies. The menu clearly says all orders are made-to-order so we were amused. The pot pie was banging. I had to have had at least 1/2 of chicken in my pot pie plus the filler was bomb, the crust was golden and flaky and was definitely a good serving size. I wanted to try the burger but wasn't that hungry so I will definitely be returning.

Came here on a Saturday night after spending the latter half of the day at the Williamsburg fair.  When we arrived, there was that many people there so we had hoped to be out within an hour and half.  Within 15 minutes, the place had filled up and even the bar area was fully occupied.  It had taken longer than expected to even receive our drinks and have the waiter take our order.  The catfish poppers were so delicious and incredibly moist.  Despite that, we had waited almost 30-40 minutes to receive it!  Juniper was definitely short staffed that day. The waiter was running around constantly, taking orders, bringing out food, handling the cash register, etc.  I never once saw him stand still for even just a second.  Our dinner took a lot longer to come, probably about an hour after we had received our appetizer!  It was taking so long and we were getting frustrated because it was way past dinner time at this point.  After telling the waiter we were about to get the check if our food wasn't done, it was ready to go.  I had ordered the bacon mac and cheese.  It was a delicious giant bowl of cheesy goodness!  Honestly, the biggest mac and cheese dish I had ever ordered!  The bread crumbs and rice krispies topping added a nice crunch and bite to the soft macaroni.  The bacon, wasn't crispy like I had though but tasted wonderful with the mac and cheese and blended in really nicely.  I had tried a bit of my brother's pulled pork sandwich and despite not being a big barbecue fan, the pork was really tender and moist and the sauce tasted pretty good.Definitely want to come back when this place isn't super packed.  Hopefully by then, they'll be more of a wait staff.  The waiter worked hard that day but if we hadn't waited so long for our food, would have given this 5 stars because the food was really enjoyable and worth the money.

My co-workers and I come here fairly often for lunch, and I cannot wait to visit Juniper for dinner.  It is truly one of our favorite spots, our dish of choice being the Steak and Cheese which is one of the best I've ever had.  I walk away thinking about this thing all the time, and was pretty obsessed with it for quite some time.Almost all the dishes you'll find here will fall under comfort foods.  And while I do wish there were a few more healthier options, you won't be disappointed with anything you get here.The portions are enormous and the fries (of all their different varieties) are quite addicting.  Burgers are perfectly cooked and tasty.  The fish dishes are soooo yummy and hugely sized.    If you're looking for a cheap lunch, the grilled cheese is a great deal and comes with Tom's super awesome french fries of your choice.  The salads are enormous and delicious.  The ribs are deboned and very tasty and the jambalya is generously flavored and portioned (though a bit too spicy for my tastes, I'm a wimp though).  I love the Steak and Cheese so much that I hardly eat anything else here.There isn't a single disappointing thing on this menu.The prices are reasonable, and while a bit high for lunch is definitely good for dinner.Tom, the owner and chef, is one of the sweetest restaurant owners you'll ever meet and he never fails to come and greet us and chat with us upon our visits.  He has done an excellent job making the restaurant feel quite homey in its personality.  You will find not a trace of pretentiousness.  It is simple in design, but you will certainly leave full and happy.  The friendly waitstaff has always been very attentive to us.There is also a very lovely and spacious garden in the back.BYOB also helps make drinks here a cheap night out!

It's getting late on a Sunday evening. Evan and I are getting hungrier. As both of these things occur and continue, our patients for deciding on the perfect place to eat starts to wane. With thoughts of settling looming on the horizon of our dinner plans, suddenly, I recalled a spot on yelp that peaked my interest a while back. I proudly declared "Ah Ha! We're trying Juniper!"We walked up about 9:30, and looked at each other nervously. "it's empty...never a good sign". Decided to give it a go based on all the positive yelp feedback anyways.We browsed the menu(s) for a quick option for an appetizer, but considering I am a pescatarian, I was at a loss. (I love mussels, but I decided to pass this evening). We asked for the Baked Mac and Cheese to start with. The adorable server proclaimed to would take 15 minutes. I protested, but boyfriend order it anyways. Good thing....because when it finally came....it was bubbling away with scorching cheesy goodness. See the photo. No, no, just go order it for yourself. I can't think of a special way to describe the dish, because, although it was like a symphony of delicious cheesy, oily, crusty-topped amazing in my mouth, it was indeed...just Mac and Cheese. I ordered the Portobello Sandwich and chose the spicy fries. Evan ordered the Truffle Burger with sweet potato fries. The Portobello Sandwich was good. Not great, not bad, but a solid "good". The brioche made the dish, but alas became soggy due to the juices from the mushroom rather quickly. Yuck. I also would have been happier if the sandwich had come with some type of sauce, perhaps an aioli of sorts? (instead of the very watery soy-based juice of my mushroom). Alas, it was tasty enough for me to eat most of it. The real star on the plate - SPICY FRIES. Not very spicy, but extra crispy and flavorful and who doesn't like a waffle fry?According to Evan, the Truffle Burger was heaven. He loved every last crumb. I heard words of praise  like "rich" and "best burger" between his full-mouth mumbling. He wasn't a fan of the fries. Their interpretation of Sweet Potato Fries was quite literal, you could taste hints of cinnamon (maybe nutmeg as well?). I tried them, they were tasty and kind of limp; I prefer my fries crispy and salty.The owner did come talk to us, and then chatted with us while we payed before leaving. He does all the cooking himself. Wow. Way to go, sir. He managed to describe some items for us to try next time (and although we just ate, left feeling excited for future food), and I must say, we will be back. *Hint- The patio is lovely on a cool evening, and rather spacious as well.

Disappointing. I was in the neighborhood and went on Yelp to find the best burger nearby, and this popped up. For $13 ($14 with cheese, and $2 more if you want bacon), the medium rare burger I ordered came out well done. After waiting for over 45 minutes for it to come out, I was too hungry to send it back. Or waitress took two smoke breaks outside while we were there, and the table next to us was served two courses well before our food arrived (they had paid and left before our burgers came out), despite arriving at the same time. The remaining waitstaff didn't cover for our absentee waitress, so we asked to pay and were eventually given a check, but no one thought to come back to collect our cash (it's cash only). We asked to pay again, cash in hand, while our now-embarrassed waitress - who was apparently uncomfortable from watching this transpire, but not uncomfortable enough to put down her cigarette, come back inside, and finish doing her job - watched from afar. We forked over close to $40 for our mediocre charred and flavorless meat (habitually tipping 20%, even against our better judgment sometimes, as here) and left in a hurry, mumbling to ourselves that we were foolish not to have gone to River Styx or Esme, for far better burgers around the same price or cheaper. As you may have guessed, we won't be returning, and hopefully this review serves as a warning to others.

The place is tiny, but we were there for lunch so it wasn't too cramped. Great food. Wish it wasn't byob though.

We also had the linguini and shrimp which was very garlicy which I like but definitely need to share with your dinner partner so both of your breath smells like garlic! Always a good place to recommend in the area.

He managed to describe some items for us to try next time (and although we just ate, left feeling excited for future food), and I must say, we will be back. *Hint- The patio is lovely on a cool evening, and rather spacious as well.

Phenomenal baked Mac N Cheese! Comes out bubbling hot and has a thick consistency. Huge serving for 8 bucks!!Loved the Fried Catfish sandwich too...def one of the best I've ever had...served with a side of amazing crispy spicy french fries!Overall, Juniper was a nice discovery last night with some friends. It's a small place so I wouldn't go there with more than three friends. The Asian lady who serves everyone is super nice and was really accommodating with our champagne and cupcakes we brought for a celebration! Will definitely return to Juniper soon!!!!

Support local business! Consistently good food after several months of orders. Burgers, fries options, and the chicken tenders are addictive. Also love the old school cash tender machine. It's definitely on the small side, but it has that local charm.

I eat here almost every week. I've only ever had the truffle burger and fish & chips, but they're both so good I can't help but order one or the other every time. The truffle burgers is one of the best burgers I've had in the city. Reasonably priced- cash only.

Came randomly after walking around and decided to try it.  Sat in the back which was a nice little area, could use some chairs with cushions n maybe a little more decor but still very chill.  Since the bf doesn't really eat meat we started with the mussels and fried shrimp.  The shrimp were huge n nicely breaded the accompanying sauce was tangy n just right, but they should give an even amount so those sharing can divide it evenly.  The mussels were very delicious and they gave a big portion def worth the price!  The sauce used to cook them in was tasty n the bread was a nice way to soak up more sauce.  We ordered two entrees but since the portions were huge!! We decided to just eat the catfish n spicy fries n save the shrimp linguine for another day! The catfish aka fish n chips was soooooo delicious!!!  The breading was perfect n the meat was very tender.  The tartar sauce was great with it, I'm not sure if it's homemade but it was delicious! The spicy fries were a bit too salty but with ketchup was fine!  All together it was a great meal left stuffed n happy!! I will def be going back if I'm in the neighborhood!!
Everything was great, especially the baked mac and cheese and BBQ. Pretty inexpensive, and BYOB is always fun.

The atmosphere is really great - there is some cool modern and street art on the walls. The service was great. Our water was regularly re-filled, we were attended to regularly, and the staff was incredibly friendly. The chef even came out of the kitchen to see how the food was.I had the BBQ Pork sandwich. The portion is large and the sandwich was pretty decent. The only downside is the bun (the pork was great, I added some Frank's Hot Sauce and mustard). I highly, highly recommend the spicy fries. They were the best part of the meal. The coleslaw was very unordinary, but it's a small side. My friend has the Truffle Burger and he really enjoyed it. Again, portion size was large, and I think I'll try it when I go back. Can't wait to try it again!

Found the menu online and sought this place out because of the burger because you can't really find a place that serves a decent sized piece of meat that isn't covered up with fancy bread and condiments. Turns out this is one of the rare restaurants where you can get an 8 oz burger with sweet fries and greens and skip the bun. Service is really good and the chef aims to please, so if it's not to your satisfaction he will take it personally and try to make it up to you. I went here three nights in a row to catch dinner while on a job in the neighborhood, now I'm thinking I need to have another burger.

We stopped by for lunch on Thursday. I had the grilled burger with spicy fries and my husband had catfish burger with sweet potato fries. Both had large portions and were excellent. Service was great and Ralph, who served us was very nice. The chef/ owner, Tom, came out and talked with us for a while. The atmosphere is casual, friendly & laid back and the food is great. Juniper has a great vibe, we will absolutely go back & bring our friends.And the health inspection grade is an A.

Been going to this place since it opened. Amazing AMAZING food. Anyone who complains about the food here has no taste. Now since it's popularity it may be a longer wait to sit but it's truly worth the wait. Food is cooked to perfection and the staff is on point. Tom comes out of the kitchen and always asks how your meal is. If you haven't been definitely go.

This place is great! The food (spicy fries, chorizo burger, rib sandwich) were amazing. In addition, the owner is so friendly and clearly has a passion for food and for his restaurant. My boyfriend is a chef, and this is the first place in a while i've heard him rave about. I can't wait to go back and try all the other things this place has to offer. I went back again and had the shrimp scampi. I was weary to try it at more of a sandwich place, but it was honestly the best shrimp scampi I've ever had (and I've had a lot!). It was so garlicy and flavorful!!

Phenomenal baked Mac N Cheese! Comes out bubbling hot and has a thick consistency. Huge serving for 8 bucks!!Loved the Fried Catfish sandwich too...def one of the best I've ever had...served with a side of amazing crispy spicy french fries!Overall, Juniper was a nice discovery last night with some friends. It's a small place so I wouldn't go there with more than three friends. The Asian lady who serves everyone is super nice and was really accommodating with our champagne and cupcakes we brought for a celebration! Will definitely return to Juniper soon!!!!

Support local business! Consistently good food after several months of orders. Burgers, fries options, and the chicken tenders are addictive. Also love the old school cash tender machine. It's definitely on the small side, but it has that local charm.

I eat here almost every week. I've only ever had the truffle burger and fish & chips, but they're both so good I can't help but order one or the other every time. The truffle burgers is one of the best burgers I've had in the city. Reasonably priced- cash only.

Came randomly after walking around and decided to try it.  Sat in the back which was a nice little area, could use some chairs with cushions n maybe a little more decor but still very chill.  Since the bf doesn't really eat meat we started with the mussels and fried shrimp.  The shrimp were huge n nicely breaded the accompanying sauce was tangy n just right, but they should give an even amount so those sharing can divide it evenly.  The mussels were very delicious and they gave a big portion def worth the price!  The sauce used to cook them in was tasty n the bread was a nice way to soak up more sauce.  We ordered two entrees but since the portions were huge!! We decided to just eat the catfish n spicy fries n save the shrimp linguine for another day! The catfish aka fish n chips was soooooo delicious!!!  The breading was perfect n the meat was very tender.  The tartar sauce was great with it, I'm not sure if it's homemade but it was delicious! The spicy fries were a bit too salty but with ketchup was fine!  All together it was a great meal left stuffed n happy!! I will def be going back if I'm in the neighborhood!!
Everything was great, especially the baked mac and cheese and BBQ. Pretty inexpensive, and BYOB is always fun.

The atmosphere is really great - there is some cool modern and street art on the walls. The service was great. Our water was regularly re-filled, we were attended to regularly, and the staff was incredibly friendly. The chef even came out of the kitchen to see how the food was.I had the BBQ Pork sandwich. The portion is large and the sandwich was pretty decent. The only downside is the bun (the pork was great, I added some Frank's Hot Sauce and mustard). I highly, highly recommend the spicy fries. They were the best part of the meal. The coleslaw was very unordinary, but it's a small side. My friend has the Truffle Burger and he really enjoyed it. Again, portion size was large, and I think I'll try it when I go back. Can't wait to try it again!

Found the menu online and sought this place out because of the burger because you can't really find a place that serves a decent sized piece of meat that isn't covered up with fancy bread and condiments. Turns out this is one of the rare restaurants where you can get an 8 oz burger with sweet fries and greens and skip the bun. Service is really good and the chef aims to please, so if it's not to your satisfaction he will take it personally and try to make it up to you. I went here three nights in a row to catch dinner while on a job in the neighborhood, now I'm thinking I need to have another burger.

We stopped by for lunch on Thursday. I had the grilled burger with spicy fries and my husband had catfish burger with sweet potato fries. Both had large portions and were excellent. Service was great and Ralph, who served us was very nice. The chef/ owner, Tom, came out and talked with us for a while. The atmosphere is casual, friendly & laid back and the food is great. Juniper has a great vibe, we will absolutely go back & bring our friends.And the health inspection grade is an A.

Been going to this place since it opened. Amazing AMAZING food. Anyone who complains about the food here has no taste. Now since it's popularity it may be a longer wait to sit but it's truly worth the wait. Food is cooked to perfection and the staff is on point. Tom comes out of the kitchen and always asks how your meal is. If you haven't been definitely go.

This place is great! The food (spicy fries, chorizo burger, rib sandwich) were amazing. In addition, the owner is so friendly and clearly has a passion for food and for his restaurant. My boyfriend is a chef, and this is the first place in a while i've heard him rave about. I can't wait to go back and try all the other things this place has to offer. I went back again and had the shrimp scampi. I was weary to try it at more of a sandwich place, but it was honestly the best shrimp scampi I've ever had (and I've had a lot!). It was so garlicy and flavorful!!

The food here is amazing! In a totally chill atmosphere! The catfish sandwich is super crispy and light! So delicious! I also loved the jabalaya, is the best that I've had, and this comes from someone who's spent a week in New Orleans! It's filled with seafood and meat! The rice to stuff proportion is divine!

Nice place but I won't eat there again. They got a "C" on the health inspection but you won't find their grade in the window because they don't want u to know instead of making improvements they took finds because they were scared the "C" grade would turn people away

Bullet points:Everything I've tried on the tiny menu is tasty and well-madeNo liquor license as of last visit, so byobSuper-nice, unpretentious people waiting tables and behind the barIt's a refreshing break from the over-hypedness that can sometimes get too much in Williamsburg.  Sometimes I don't want artisanally produced greens/water/air and excruciatingly designed everything else.  That said, I've got mixed feelings about the room; once in a while it feels too bare, even though it's small, and at other times the sparse decoration feels soothing.Wanted to review it because more people should try it.  It's almost always uncrowded probably because of the lack of a liquor license, not because it's not good.  Ack, I hate double negatives.

But seriously, the food here is remarkable. The catfish sandwich with spicy fries is mind blowing. Whenever I go to Smorgasburg I end up not getting anything and just coming to Juniper because it's all I want.Service is craaaazy slow though. There's never more than one or two tables of people when I'm there, but it still takes over 20 minutes for the food to come out.My friends and I actually started calling ahead with our orders and showing up there to eat in the backyard haha. It's pay-at-the-counter style, so you can easily do this without looking like a huge douche canoe.Backyard is adorable, it's always nice and quiet and full of space so you can bring a whole group of people there.

I love Juniper. I'm usually not a dick, but to those who say this restaurant is terrible; you suck, you're mean, too snobby, had a crazy fluke meal, or are just plain wrong. The duo of Tom and Dee are the best! They're so nice, and always treat me kindly. Me and my friend usually go there early (around 5:00 p.m.) and sit in the fenced in backyard (where we can smoke cigs before our meal comes out, yes I know, it's aweful, I'm trying to quit). Juniper mostly serves comfort food, some cajun, and burgers. I usually get the jumbalaya, it's awesome. The clams on top are definitely like the icing on the jumbalaya cake. It packs a little spice, but is rich in flavor and fills the belly. I've only had a burger from there once, but it was cooked the way I wanted, was pretty big, and was flavorful. I also like their 'spicy cajun fries' and their sweet potato fries are good as well. Their mac n' cheese is good as well. I've never had a disappointing meal from Juniper.And another great added bonus is that Juniper is BYOB, so me and my friend usually get some 22's of Corona and chill there for a while before and after our meal. And usually Tom (chef and owner) pops out of the kitchen and just chats with us, if it's not too busy. Dee is a sweetheart (cute too), and takes great care of me and my friend whenever we're there. Me and my friend will continue going here, it's our 'go-to spot' in the neighborhood when we want something familiar and know we're going to be fed well.

I love everything about this place:- the meat in the burger is awesome- it is a BYOB, no corkage fee- the service is friendly and quick- the checkout is so cool- prices are fine - deco is minimalist but still pleasant
This place took too long. We waited for almost an hour to get our food. This makes me feel salty.

Juniper is one of those "accidental discoveries".. My friend and I were taking a walk around the neighborhood, and of course, the cold didn't forgive anyone walking by , so we decided to enter this restaurant in a heart beat. The main appeal was the "cozy" look it had from the outside, and it didn't look like you had to wait 30 minutes just to be seated.. we came in , looked around and was promptly greeted , and before I knew it , i was seated and had water and a menu in my hand.. that to me is good service. The food was great , both the appetizers and the main dishes, I would highly recommend the Philly cheesesteak burger.. delicious.

You have failed me.DO:-N/ADON'T:-Truffle burger was a huge disappointment. Umami in LA anyone?PARKING:-Street parkingFirst time in Brooklyn and I was excited. Relied on my fellow Yelpers to direct me in the right direction. I ordered the truffle burger expecting greatness. What I received was a greasy mess with no sign of any flavor. Maybe it was an off day for Juniper, I'm not sure. But Brooklyn Yelpers failed me, hard.

It was a bit crowded when we first arrived, so I left my number and went to find another place to eat in case the wait turned out to be too long. About a block away, they called to let me know our table was ready, so we went back. The woman seating us was super polite the entire time. I had the Chorizo Burger, which was absolutely delicious, with a side of sweet potato fries that came with an excellent chipotle dipping sauce. My girlfriend had the pulled pork sliders appetizer, which was really good, but served with those small dried up "fries" that you buy in a dollar store next to the potato chips - I think it's a little weird when restaurants give you that as a side. It's BYOB, with a corking fee of $1 per beer and $5 per wine bottle - pretty standard for BYOB places. It's decor could use a little work, and it was pretty loud and cramped, but the food was great and the service was good, so I would definitely recommend to friends in the area.

The food here is amazing! In a totally chill atmosphere! The catfish sandwich is super crispy and light! So delicious! I also loved the jabalaya, is the best that I've had, and this comes from someone who's spent a week in New Orleans! It's filled with seafood and meat! The rice to stuff proportion is divine!

Nice place but I won't eat there again. They got a "C" on the health inspection but you won't find their grade in the window because they don't want u to know instead of making improvements they took finds because they were scared the "C" grade would turn people away

It's decor could use a little work, and it was pretty loud and cramped, but the food was great and the service was good, so I would definitely recommend to friends in the area.

Was planning to have brunch at Cafe Colette but line was spewing onto Street. Walked up Berry & saw Juniper, even though we wanted brunch items & theres none there, we wanted to give the underdogs a try. We sat down and had 3 burgers. They were EXCELLENT and super delicious. Will definitely return... We think the burgers + fries are better than Dumont :o)Must try their sweet potato fries- very addictive..

The place is BYOB, which is always awesome.I had a cheesburger.  It tasted like it had been very frozen, then cooked on a griddle while having a lot of oil added to it.  I can't imagine the fat content of that burger.Meat quality was a little below average, and had pretty clearly emerged from a deep freeze.The fries were ok.  I would only come back if I were drunk.Great service.  They let me put my bike inside.People thinking this is a better burger than Five Leaves or Dumont are nuts.
The owners are amazing and just so pleasant to deal with. NOW.....their truffle burger is off the gawd damn chain. Juicy, succulent, fantastic meat....just an experience in itself. Done. 'Nuff said.

The catfish sandwich was huge and delicious. Pulled pork was amazing. BYOB is perfect for going to dinner before shows in the area. Tom, the owner, was very nice and welcoming. Don't order the mac n cheese if you're in a bit of a rush to get somewhere. It's delicious, but it takes a while to make, you might wanna call ahead and order.

My overall experience was terrible. Not only did the waiter give me the wrong fries, the ketchup bottle was disgustingly dripping in ketchup with a weak pouring spout that fell off and spilled all over my food. Not to mention there was a fly in my water. Disappointed but I guess everyone else has different experiences.

We had a wonderful time at this restaurant. It is definitely low key and family run. The food is delicious and is served hot. We had the fried shrimp, jambalaya, and rib sandwich. All were amazing and we would get them all again. Everything is reasonably priced. They have a nice open garden area in the back.It's BYOB and CASH only.

Unfortunately, Based on the food only, I would have to give it 3 stars. The service, atmosphere, backyard, BYOB policy, and southern menu were awesome. For that I would want to give it 4 or 5. But for most of us, we want the food to be great when there are so many 5 star reviews for a place!! The slow cooked boneless rib sandwich was a let down, maybe because of the 'slow cooked' in the name I expected the ribs to be softer. The truffle cheeseburger was quite well done and alas dry, I was really disappointed by this, truffle and Gouda would have been great otherwise! However, The best hot wings I've ever had were found here!! I'd definitely go back for those.
Consistently delicious!  Great food, nice staff, and the chef makes every dish to order.  We've been there many times, and it's always amazing.  : )

So it is my mission to try new places in Brooklyn so I picked this one for a weekday lunch.  The place is super cute, the service was excellent all around.  The waitress was really friendly and since I tend to be a food modifier the chef came out to talk to me about my sandwich choice.  He made it clear that he was happy to do whatever I liked with the sandwich (by the way, I had the catfish sandwich... try it... you're welcome!) but he recommended it as it is presented.  Long story short: I trusted him, he was right.... that's probably why he's a chef and I'm not.  The catfish was a perfect, yummy delight and the scallion remoulade (that I got on the side but normally comes on the sandwich) was super yummy!   I will definitely try them again, maybe next time for brunch.  Loved the friendly vibe and excellent service.
friendliest and best service i've had in willyburg. byob for now though that may change in the near future.

Will definitely return... We think the burgers + fries are better than Dumont :o)Must try their sweet potato fries- very addictive..

However, The best hot wings I've ever had were found here!! I'd definitely go back for those.
Consistently delicious!  Great food, nice staff, and the chef makes every dish to order.  We've been there many times, and it's always amazing.  : )

So it is my mission to try new places in Brooklyn so I picked this one for a weekday lunch.  The place is super cute, the service was excellent all around.  The waitress was really friendly and since I tend to be a food modifier the chef came out to talk to me about my sandwich choice.  He made it clear that he was happy to do whatever I liked with the sandwich (by the way, I had the catfish sandwich... try it... you're welcome!) but he recommended it as it is presented.  Long story short: I trusted him, he was right.... that's probably why he's a chef and I'm not.  The catfish was a perfect, yummy delight and the scallion remoulade (that I got on the side but normally comes on the sandwich) was super yummy!   I will definitely try them again, maybe next time for brunch.  Loved the friendly vibe and excellent service.
friendliest and best service i've had in willyburg. byob for now though that may change in the near future.

Hands down the best comfort american soul fat ass food around. Just don't try to get fancy; stick to the classics and you'll be in love in no time. Get the catfish sammie, mac and cheese and spicy fries and see if you can walk a block.I dare you.But hell-all, you'll be back with a smile.The guy who runs it and cooks it is a fine specimen of old school new york, and is a lot of fun to be around. He's also a big supporter of BYOB.

if you are looking for a casual place to eat a good meal with out a crowd, this is it.  it isnt on Willie b's main strips so Friday night isnt that bad. I had the chorizo burger which is great.   the spicy fries were just as good.  i think that the Friday rush caught the staff off guard but still it was handled fairly well

I'm from the South and I've been thinking about finding a great Cajun place to swamp on some jambalaya or etouffée. Fortunately, I was walking around the 'Burg looking for lunch on Sunday and stumbled across Juniper. A waft of slow-cooked BBQ and a sign for catfish stopped me in my tracks.The downside of this story is they had just run out of pulled pork and braised ribs, but the upside is I had the catfish sandwich. It was light and crisp, well-peppered and topped with a perfectly balanced garlic aioli. And the french fries? Just as good. Seriously, come here and try the fries.I want to come back and try the truffle burger and the jambalaya (shrimp, chicken, andouille, mussels!). The service was quick and the server, she was very busy but still available (it's a small place) and, of most importance, friendly. The chef popped out and apologized for the lack of BBQ, but welcomed us to come back later for freshly cooked BBQ. It was tempting, but I was stuffed. I thanked him for the offer and will definitely be back.Which will be soon.
Had the best experience here. the chef was very friendly and gave my friend and me a complimentary dish so we got to try both the truffle burgers and the pork sliders. I recommend both!

Juniper has the best catfish sandwich I ever had! We got there early and it seemed that everyone there was ordering this. We couldn't have been there more than an hour before they ran out of it! Their fries are really good too! Yummmm.
Cash only place.  It's yummy.  I liked it a lot.  I ordered a lot of fried things and loved it.  Yumz!

So nice relaxed spot, but small: Good for 2 or 4-5 people; not moreReally nice host, fun and not invasiveGood big and spicy jambalaya (was it on the menu or just special?)Great musselsGreat truffle burgerBYOB, kind of ok :)
Solid. Sweet potato fries for the win!

Conveniently located only 1 block from the Bedford L train stop, Juniper boasts one of Williamsburg's best spots for comfort food and down-home dishes.Here's the rundown:- Burger: The foundation staple. Juicy, thick patty, always seasoned and cooked to perfection. Served on soft sweet roll with slice of red onion, pickle, tomato and lettuce on the side. The key is the seasoning. I'm a burger addict and have no reservation admitting the Truffle Burger rivals any neighborhood mainstay. Combine with spicy waffle fries and it's hammer time.- Pulled Pork Sandwich / Sliders: Tender meat, hint of smoke, lathered in homemade BBQ sauce with a generous kick of spice. It tastes exactly how you would dream of this southern classic. - Steak & Cheese: Perfect meat to cheese ratio, piled high, spilling over an unconventional soft round sweet roll. Delicious version for the Philly connoisseurs.- Catfish Sandwich: Fresh, thinly sliced and lightly breaded strips served on a tasty Italian style roll. This item will appear as a special and is nice change of pace. If I recall, this was served with a side of garlic baby bok choy. All ingredients fresh and purchased at local markets.- Jambalaya: Louisiana dish with Creole and Cajun influences. Laced with signature spice, chunks of chicken, sausage, fish, shrimp, tomatoes and rice. Plenty of heat and dense with flavor.Other items I've tried: Mussels w/white wine & shallots, chicken fried steak, cajun shrimp salad, macaroni & cheese.Atmosphere is relaxed and casual. Relatively small space with patio access. Flat screen TV above the bar. BYOB at the time of writing this review. Sunac grocery store is located on North 7th St. Plenty of drinks and sodas including Boylan's Black Cherry on the premises.What makes Juniper special and truly separates it from the surrounding establishments is the owner and chef, Tom. He is very friendly and will often come out of the kitchen to personally greet his patrons. Juniper is a standout in Williamsburg's burgeoning restaurant scene. It's the perfect neighborhood haunt. Down-home and delicious.

Juniper is an excellent casual dining restaurant where the price is right, the service friendly, and the food on point.  I had the jambalaya which was perfectly spiced and filled with savory chorizo and fatty mussels.  I had some of the fries from my friends' plates (regular and sweet potato) and they were a perfect cut, lightly fried, but crispy and seasoned in a really unique way (spicy, salty, and maybe a little old bay(?)). The place is BYO which is a great bonus to add to the already reasonable prices.  They will put your beer in the fridge while you eat and serve it to you as you eat as if they were ordered drinks. My only complaint is that we waited quite a long time for the food to come out, but with BYO drinks in hand, who really cares anyway?

He's also a big supporter of BYOB.

The chef popped out and apologized for the lack of BBQ, but welcomed us to come back later for freshly cooked BBQ. It was tempting, but I was stuffed. I thanked him for the offer and will definitely be back.Which will be soon.
Had the best experience here. the chef was very friendly and gave my friend and me a complimentary dish so we got to try both the truffle burgers and the pork sliders. I recommend both!

Juniper has the best catfish sandwich I ever had! We got there early and it seemed that everyone there was ordering this. We couldn't have been there more than an hour before they ran out of it! Their fries are really good too! Yummmm.
Cash only place.  It's yummy.  I liked it a lot.  I ordered a lot of fried things and loved it.  Yumz!

So nice relaxed spot, but small: Good for 2 or 4-5 people; not moreReally nice host, fun and not invasiveGood big and spicy jambalaya (was it on the menu or just special?)Great musselsGreat truffle burgerBYOB, kind of ok :)
Solid. Sweet potato fries for the win!

Conveniently located only 1 block from the Bedford L train stop, Juniper boasts one of Williamsburg's best spots for comfort food and down-home dishes.Here's the rundown:- Burger: The foundation staple. Juicy, thick patty, always seasoned and cooked to perfection. Served on soft sweet roll with slice of red onion, pickle, tomato and lettuce on the side. The key is the seasoning. I'm a burger addict and have no reservation admitting the Truffle Burger rivals any neighborhood mainstay. Combine with spicy waffle fries and it's hammer time.- Pulled Pork Sandwich / Sliders: Tender meat, hint of smoke, lathered in homemade BBQ sauce with a generous kick of spice. It tastes exactly how you would dream of this southern classic. - Steak & Cheese: Perfect meat to cheese ratio, piled high, spilling over an unconventional soft round sweet roll. Delicious version for the Philly connoisseurs.- Catfish Sandwich: Fresh, thinly sliced and lightly breaded strips served on a tasty Italian style roll. This item will appear as a special and is nice change of pace. If I recall, this was served with a side of garlic baby bok choy. All ingredients fresh and purchased at local markets.- Jambalaya: Louisiana dish with Creole and Cajun influences. Laced with signature spice, chunks of chicken, sausage, fish, shrimp, tomatoes and rice. Plenty of heat and dense with flavor.Other items I've tried: Mussels w/white wine & shallots, chicken fried steak, cajun shrimp salad, macaroni & cheese.Atmosphere is relaxed and casual. Relatively small space with patio access. Flat screen TV above the bar. BYOB at the time of writing this review. Sunac grocery store is located on North 7th St. Plenty of drinks and sodas including Boylan's Black Cherry on the premises.What makes Juniper special and truly separates it from the surrounding establishments is the owner and chef, Tom. He is very friendly and will often come out of the kitchen to personally greet his patrons. Juniper is a standout in Williamsburg's burgeoning restaurant scene. It's the perfect neighborhood haunt. Down-home and delicious.

Juniper is an excellent casual dining restaurant where the price is right, the service friendly, and the food on point.  I had the jambalaya which was perfectly spiced and filled with savory chorizo and fatty mussels.  I had some of the fries from my friends' plates (regular and sweet potato) and they were a perfect cut, lightly fried, but crispy and seasoned in a really unique way (spicy, salty, and maybe a little old bay(?)). The place is BYO which is a great bonus to add to the already reasonable prices.  They will put your beer in the fridge while you eat and serve it to you as you eat as if they were ordered drinks. My only complaint is that we waited quite a long time for the food to come out, but with BYO drinks in hand, who really cares anyway?
Absolutely love their food. Portions are huge and prices are decent. The owner is very nice. Truffle burger and mussels are amazing. Yum Yum. Oh and also BYOB, what more can you ask for

After reading mostly positive reviews, I was pumped to try this place!.. And my party and I were pretty let down. At our table we had the pumpkin bisque, Mac n cheese, mussels, and truffle burger with sweet potato fries. Ehhh. Everything was pretty bland. The Mac n cheese was good but the cheese to noodles ratio was a bit off- it was more like eating Kraft cheese soup with a few noodles in there. The sweet potato fries could have been good as a dessert item, they were totally covered in sugar and cinnamon- not something one normally craves to accompany the burger. The burger was alright but the beef did not seem to be of very high quality. The mussels were pretty basic, nothing incredible. The pumpkin bisque was actually pretty yummy. The menu just seems to be kinda random.But the absolute worst part of the meal was the loud group of 5 or 6 guys that were literally yelling back and forth (Hello! This is a super tiny place, is that really necessary!?) they kept screaming profanities and kicking chairs around. Nobody in my group even wanted to look in their direction for fear of really setting them off. I could see that they were driving everyone else to leave and I couldn't believe that the owner didn't ask them to chill. We left immediately after eating due to their obnoxious behavior and none of us plan on going back.

Very nice place with very good burgers and sandwiches! We had the Pulled Pork Sandwich and the Truffel Burger. The PPS was amazing and the Truffel Burger was one of the best medium cooked burgers I ever ate! Even it is a little expensive (PPS $12, Truffel Burger $15) BYOB justifies the price ;)I definitely will go there again!

Def a hidden gem in the Bedford-adjacent restaurant scene. ALL of the food here is great (think "high end comfort food"); I have had just about everything on the menu. My personal faves include:AMAZING truffle burger! Maybe the best burger in Williamsburg.Jambalaya that is the perfect level of spicy - very very tasty!Mac n Cheese - crusty on top and creamy on the inside.BYOB - another plus. Also, Tom, the owner, always comes out and makes an effort to personally speak to each table.I love it and will continue to go back often!

Juniper is one of the greatest values in Williamsburg.  The atmosphere has a bit to be desired (unless you're there during a warm enough season to sit in the back patio), but the food more than makes up for it.  For the quality of food that you get here, the value is huge, too.  It doesn't hurt that it's a BYO, so even with a bottle of wine, you can get out of there for 2 for $30 easily.  I highly recommend the mussles appetizer--they are big and fresh.  The mac and cheese is great, too.
the best burger in NYC - Period, Friendly owner and staff!

Totally quaint little spot. Small operation that has a cozy feel. Mac n' Cheese, truffle burger and sweet potato fries we're all on point. There was a delay with the food, so they sent some fries out first which was thoughtful and the cook came around to ask how things were and to chat with some other patrons.

Went here w/the husband for lunch.  We ordered the chicken tenders & pulled pork sliders for appetizers.  The chicken tenders were really good, had a nice crunchiness to them.  I'm not a big fan of pulled pork but the sliders were good too.  My husband ordered the truffle burger & I ordered the wonton noodles.  The really friendly waitress explained that they recommend Gouda for the truffle burger & that the noodles were sauteed & not in broth.  We said both were fine.  It seemed like we waited a while for the burger & noodles.  The waitress was really attentive & kept refilling our water glasses.  The truffle burger looked nice but my husband was disappointed that the burger was well done instead of medium.  The noodles came out perfect & the waitress came back to ask about it since I told her I didn't want it too spicy.

I had some friends in town from the west, and we all wanted a good burger. I had never been here before, but we were all pleasantly surprised. I ordered the truffle burger (as did a friend of mine), and it was really really good! Another friend ordered the pulled pork sandwich, which became too much food for her, especially including the fries that come with your order. The burgers might seem pricey, but they're pretty big and come with fries, so I would say it was a good value.Additionally, the place is BYOB and has a pretty relaxed vibe. We were able to get a table there on a Saturday night at ~8:00 with no problem.Definitely a good spot to check out!

Six foodie people in our party and we took a chance on a yelp-highly-rated restaurant. After walking into the place (would the front table work?) and walking to the back patio (too muggy to sit outside), my sweetie says, "Do you still want to eat here?"  I respond, "This place is highly recommended and I'm up for whatever this experience is." So we sit down and order.After the first bite of the pulled pork sandwich, my food-snob sweetie exclaims, "WOW!" And that kinda sums up our experience. The physical space may not be impressive, but everyone loved the food. Cash only. BBQ rocks! Spicy fries aren't too spicy.
Absolutely love their food. Portions are huge and prices are decent. The owner is very nice. Truffle burger and mussels are amazing. Yum Yum. Oh and also BYOB, what more can you ask for

The burger was alright but the beef did not seem to be of very high quality. The mussels were pretty basic, nothing incredible. The pumpkin bisque was actually pretty yummy. The menu just seems to be kinda random.But the absolute worst part of the meal was the loud group of 5 or 6 guys that were literally yelling back and forth (Hello! This is a super tiny place, is that really necessary!?) they kept screaming profanities and kicking chairs around. Nobody in my group even wanted to look in their direction for fear of really setting them off. We left immediately after eating due to their obnoxious behavior and none of us plan on going back.

The PPS was amazing and the Truffel Burger was one of the best medium cooked burgers I ever ate! Even it is a little expensive (PPS $12, Truffel Burger $15) BYOB justifies the price ;)I definitely will go there again!

Also, Tom, the owner, always comes out and makes an effort to personally speak to each table.I love it and will continue to go back often!

We were able to get a table there on a Saturday night at ~8:00 with no problem.Definitely a good spot to check out!

Six foodie people in our party and we took a chance on a yelp-highly-rated restaurant. After walking into the place (would the front table work?) and walking to the back patio (too muggy to sit outside), my sweetie says, "Do you still want to eat here?"  I respond, "This place is highly recommended and I'm up for whatever this experience is." So we sit down and order.After the first bite of the pulled pork sandwich, my food-snob sweetie exclaims, "WOW!" And that kinda sums up our experience. The physical space may not be impressive, but everyone loved the food. Cash only. BBQ rocks! Spicy fries aren't too spicy.

I LOVE this place. I was craving a burger, and I didn't feel like straying too far from my apartment. I hopped on yelp and did some research. Thank you yelpers! Juniper is my true love, well besides my sweet boyfriend...but I digress. I love love love truffles, truffle oil, anything truffle related and juniper has a truffle burger. I added mozzerella cheese and it was ballerrrr! Cooked perfectly medium. Wonderous! Spicy fries are a must, so good. I've also had the Mac and cheese and the chicken fingers (breaded with rice krispies) get behind it! Both were delicious. The cheese was well balanced in the Mac ie not too soupy, thick, or paste like. The chef used tagliatelle pasta, always so good! Boyfriend has had the short rib sandwich and the pulled pork. I've tried them both. Awesome. A sweet, smoky, molasses-y BBQ sauce covers both, the perfect balance of salt and sweet. Did I mention the spicy fries? I did? Oh well, worth mentioning again. To all those nay-sayers out there, the reason the restaurant runs out of menu items is because everything is made fresh to order....that's a good thing. If you want mass quantity over quality go to McDonalds. You'll be welcome there. It's also byob. Hi. Hello.The chef is super cool. He always comes out to talk to you while you're eating. He asks how the food is and tells you about the prep/recipes. I love that. Being a food nerd and all. Just go to juniper. It's awesome.
I had a truffle burger and regular fries...soooo good!!! I love this place and will come back soon!

Came here with 5 friends from the Biergarten and wow, this place has some serious burgers. They have a small menu, but I assure you, everything on it is excellent! The Chorizo burger with Gorgonzola cheese was juicy and amazing when you par it with the spicy fries. This quaint place is worth the visit. FYI: it's cash only and BYO... So drink up!

JUMPIN' JUNIPER!A couple of friends and I decided to grab burgers for dinner.  I remembered walking past this place and we all looked on Yelp to see favorable ratings.  When he headed over around 8PM on a Friday night, there were only a couple of tables occupied.  Things that make you go hmm?  But, we sat down anyway and perused the menu with the hope that we hadn't been steered wrong.  We ordered the following: Crab Bisque - Pretty good.  I'm not really a soup person unless I'm freezing to death.Baked Macaroni & Cheese (special) - Creamy and topped with panko but a little under-seasoned.Burgers + Fries - I'm a sucker for a good burger and fries and Juniper ain't playing.  Regular, Sweet Potato, AND Spicy Fries.  ALL delicious!  Simple but delicious and well-prepared.  WIN!But the pièce de résistance was definitely the BBQ Rib Sandwich.Long, long ago in a galaxy far, far away... I ate a McRib sandwich.  In theory, it should be the greatest sandwich ever.  But, it was not and I never went near one again.Juniper created what should have been the additional bajillion dollars that McDonald's made on the McRib.  HOLY COW.Juicy, succulent boneless ribs with a slather of barbecue sauce that has a slight kick, topped with pickles on a brioche bun.  YUMMMMMMMSIES.The BYOB is just the cherry on top.  Woooo!  Our bill was like $54 for three people.

Had dinner with my wife last Saturday as I stumbled upon this place by chance.  I had parked in front of the restaurant with my '75 VW beetle convertible and met the owner/chef Tom who had come out to talk shop and invited us to check out his place.  We had plans already and started off at Cubana Social for happy hour and empanadas then over to Fette Sau for dinner but the line was out to the street already.  So we trekked back to Juniper and ordered the jambalaya and an off seasonal chicken pot pie and was very happy the line was out to the street at Fette Sau!  Juniper was tasty comfort food at great prices.  We love little gem places like this.  The jambalaya was fresh and tasty with shrimp. mussels and scallops and the chicken pot pie had a bounty full of fresh garden vegetables with tender moist chicken, topped with a puff pastry lattice.  Tom let us try his bbq pulled porked sandwhich on the house and it was tender and savory.  We will definitely be back with our friends and this time BYOB.  He is awaiting his beer and wine license.  I did not know he had a back garden dining area until reading the reviews below but it just adds to the whole flavor of this little gem.  Thank you Tom!
Great find! Cajun shrimp salad was wonderful, burgers were large, juicy and flavorful. Would highly recommend!

Pros: Lives up to all great reviews on Yelp! Friendly, welcoming atmosphere, and yes, Tom the owner comes out to chat and see how the meal is going. Best catfish sandwich I have ever had in my life, it was a special but Tom says they will have it on the menu for the summer -- I highly recommend it.  Reasonably priced, music not too loud, huge lovely garden in the back.  I will definitely be returning.Cons: No beer or wine yet, coming soon (I asked).Conclusion: If you're looking for an unpretentious setting, excellent service, and delicious food you are in luck.

wow I am surprise i don't know this place in my own neighborhood.  Friend of mine took me here on a slow Sunday, I believe we spent about 3 hours here. it's BYOB.AWESOME food, I believe the couple is the owner and husband is the chief and they are very friendly. the place is never too packed which is always good. feel very homely. I can't wait to come back here !

My date's and my idea of spontaneously picking a restaurant consisted of getting off the train and consulting our Yelp app for the highest rated place within a 4 block radius.All stars pointed to Juniper, but I was skeptical due to diner atmosphere I gathered from the reviews. But a tiny, cozy restaurant happily greeted me with a friendly waitress and a head chef mingling with the other late night patrons. In an attempt to order healthily, I chose the evening's special Cajun shrimp salad, though my date's burger and spicy fries stole the show. For being a special, and not necessarily cheap, I expected more for my salad. My precisely counted 6 shrimp lay on a boring bed of what seemed like your average bag of greens. The dressing was too spicy (hot, not flavor) and the only mix ins (mango and tomato) were sparse and offered little to the dish. Could have done for a more thoughtful recipe.Despite the mediocre salad, the comfort food was great and the environment was perfect for a winter evening. And hey, BYOB.
Everything was great except no bar but still you can bring in alcoholic beverages from outside and enjoy them inside ;) burgers are on point will be back soon
