Ok, I would have given this place 5 stars for their great food and the fact it's BYOB.  4 stars because I went there last night and a sign on the door said it was closed by the Health Department :(

The food is amazing - you will not be disappointed. We've been here a few times and have been really happy with everything we've ordered. The service is great, the prices are good and the owner will come over and talk to you to make sure you're satisfied with your meal.This place is usually empty, or mostly so, probably because it doesn't look like the best place to eat from the outside (or, really, the inside). I feel like this is what could be keeping people away when the food is so good.

The food is amazing here. I recently moved to Brooklyn; I started researching some local burger places and Junipers caught my eye. The place is surprisingly small for all the hype it has received on Yelp, but the food doesn't disappoint.The menu only consists of a handful of items, but everything on the menu is delicious. Each dish is executed perfectly and presented in a very artistic manner. My personal favorites are the baked mac and cheese (for 7 dollars it makes a great lunch) and the grilled burger. The spicy fries are not spicy, but I find them to be seasoned perfectly. The sweet potatoes fries also add a nice change of pace. Also if you get two entrees you can get a free appetizer for mentioning Yelp.The atmosphere is very friendly.  I have experienced anywhere from a 15-40 minute wait since Tom is the only one in the kitchen. It really depends on how busy it is. In this part of the town, business usually picks up after 8.Tom usually comes out after your meal to ask you personally how you liked it. You can tell this is a restaurant that strives to satisfy their customers.

Having lived in New Orleans  I can tell you that the jambalaya is the real deal. The catfish sandwich is massive but is also delicious. Get the mussels and the spicy fries but there is no need for the mac and cheese. The place is BYOB and the food is substantial and on the money. Great stuff! we will surely be back soon.

Wow, this might be the best burger in the city.  Its really amazing.  Plus the place is very cool, and the owners are nice and the service is great.  Also its in a fun neighborhood, but tucked away on a not crowded street.  What could be better?Looks like bad reviews have come from non-bell curve rating distribution reviewers, and those people are the scum of the earth.  Do yourself a favor and pay Juniper a visit.

I've been here a total of three times and every time, Tom the chef-owner always checks in, gives a recommendation and spends a few minutes talking to us. Tonight was special though-- even Deedee the server sat down with us and told me I was ridiculous for deciding between the Cobb and Mac&Cheese... the choice was clear. And it was! It was the richest, creamiest mac and cheese, even tastier that Sarita's in the East Village whose specialty IS mac and cheese. Felt like I was punched in the mouth with cheese. But truly, everything on the menu is great (I can personally attest to the pulled pork sandwich, burger and sweet potato fries). I mean, if you're a vegetarian, you might be limited by the selection and I feel sorry for you but if you're a good meat-loving human being, you're in luck! The best part is that there were only two tables in the restaurant and Tom sat with us and talked about his dishes, his childhood in New York etc etc. He gives the place such a friendly, neighborhood vibe and personally, I love how the horn-rimmed glasses and plaid wearing populace has steered clear of it so far (though I admit their arrival would herald the success of the place)... probably because the music selection is not as hip. It does win points for irony though... imagine Savage Garden side by side with Led Zeppelin. This is definitely my number one grub spot for the Bedford stop.

Juniper.  What a fun experience in dining.  The staff was so inviting and warm, it almost was like I was dining amongst family.  I had the pulled pork sandwich which I will admit was just a bit TOO sauce-y for me but I am also incredibly picky when it comes to pulled pork.  The fries were incredible!  So delicious!  I honestly can't wait to come back and try something else. Also, my friend and I were literally held hostage by this place.  You might be reading that last sentence and are really confused but it was such a funny little Seinfeld-ish moment.  During the course of the meal, the rain came down.  When we asked for our check, our server LITERALLY said "No, you can't it's raining.  You should stay and hang out."  After 15 minutes, we realized she was not kidding.  Whatever, it was cute.  It's not like we had anywhere to go!
Delicious burgers and amazing service! The truffle burger was juicy and delicious and the fries were crunchy! It's ByO so it turns out to be super cheap. Only downside is they don't have dessert

Some of the tastiest burgers and we found out why, from the source himself, the chef and owner. He seasons the meat prior to grilling so its not bland. I like that a lot.The one buzzkill is the waiter. He could use an a little more curtesy. You know when you have a waiter that drags his tail with every request? Yeah, that one. We didn't get a thank you with when we paid either. A little more than irksome.

The food is really really good but the friendliness of the owner is what really makes a difference.I have been twice now. The first time alone and i had the burger with spicy fries. The burger was perfectly cooked, perfectly seasoned and all around solid burger.The owner Tom came out from the kitchen and asked how it was and sat and talked for a while. Great experience!I went back today with my wife and we had the mussels in white wine sauce, pulled pork sandwich, and truffle burger. All were excellent. I definitely see this restaurant becoming a place that i will frequent.
Ok, I would have given this place 5 stars for their great food and the fact it's BYOB.  4 stars because I went there last night and a sign on the door said it was closed by the Health Department :(

The food is amazing - you will not be disappointed. We've been here a few times and have been really happy with everything we've ordered. The service is great, the prices are good and the owner will come over and talk to you to make sure you're satisfied with your meal.This place is usually empty, or mostly so, probably because it doesn't look like the best place to eat from the outside (or, really, the inside). I feel like this is what could be keeping people away when the food is so good.

The food is amazing here. I recently moved to Brooklyn; I started researching some local burger places and Junipers caught my eye. The place is surprisingly small for all the hype it has received on Yelp, but the food doesn't disappoint.The menu only consists of a handful of items, but everything on the menu is delicious. Each dish is executed perfectly and presented in a very artistic manner. My personal favorites are the baked mac and cheese (for 7 dollars it makes a great lunch) and the grilled burger. The spicy fries are not spicy, but I find them to be seasoned perfectly. The sweet potatoes fries also add a nice change of pace. Also if you get two entrees you can get a free appetizer for mentioning Yelp.The atmosphere is very friendly.  I have experienced anywhere from a 15-40 minute wait since Tom is the only one in the kitchen. It really depends on how busy it is. In this part of the town, business usually picks up after 8.Tom usually comes out after your meal to ask you personally how you liked it. You can tell this is a restaurant that strives to satisfy their customers.

Having lived in New Orleans  I can tell you that the jambalaya is the real deal. The catfish sandwich is massive but is also delicious. Get the mussels and the spicy fries but there is no need for the mac and cheese. The place is BYOB and the food is substantial and on the money. Great stuff! we will surely be back soon.

Wow, this might be the best burger in the city.  Its really amazing.  Plus the place is very cool, and the owners are nice and the service is great.  Also its in a fun neighborhood, but tucked away on a not crowded street.  What could be better?Looks like bad reviews have come from non-bell curve rating distribution reviewers, and those people are the scum of the earth.  Do yourself a favor and pay Juniper a visit.

I've been here a total of three times and every time, Tom the chef-owner always checks in, gives a recommendation and spends a few minutes talking to us. Tonight was special though-- even Deedee the server sat down with us and told me I was ridiculous for deciding between the Cobb and Mac&Cheese... the choice was clear. And it was! It was the richest, creamiest mac and cheese, even tastier that Sarita's in the East Village whose specialty IS mac and cheese. Felt like I was punched in the mouth with cheese. But truly, everything on the menu is great (I can personally attest to the pulled pork sandwich, burger and sweet potato fries). I mean, if you're a vegetarian, you might be limited by the selection and I feel sorry for you but if you're a good meat-loving human being, you're in luck! The best part is that there were only two tables in the restaurant and Tom sat with us and talked about his dishes, his childhood in New York etc etc. He gives the place such a friendly, neighborhood vibe and personally, I love how the horn-rimmed glasses and plaid wearing populace has steered clear of it so far (though I admit their arrival would herald the success of the place)... probably because the music selection is not as hip. It does win points for irony though... imagine Savage Garden side by side with Led Zeppelin. This is definitely my number one grub spot for the Bedford stop.

Juniper.  What a fun experience in dining.  The staff was so inviting and warm, it almost was like I was dining amongst family.  I had the pulled pork sandwich which I will admit was just a bit TOO sauce-y for me but I am also incredibly picky when it comes to pulled pork.  The fries were incredible!  So delicious!  I honestly can't wait to come back and try something else. Also, my friend and I were literally held hostage by this place.  You might be reading that last sentence and are really confused but it was such a funny little Seinfeld-ish moment.  During the course of the meal, the rain came down.  When we asked for our check, our server LITERALLY said "No, you can't it's raining.  You should stay and hang out."  After 15 minutes, we realized she was not kidding.  Whatever, it was cute.  It's not like we had anywhere to go!
Delicious burgers and amazing service! The truffle burger was juicy and delicious and the fries were crunchy! It's ByO so it turns out to be super cheap. Only downside is they don't have dessert

Some of the tastiest burgers and we found out why, from the source himself, the chef and owner. He seasons the meat prior to grilling so its not bland. I like that a lot.The one buzzkill is the waiter. He could use an a little more curtesy. You know when you have a waiter that drags his tail with every request? Yeah, that one. We didn't get a thank you with when we paid either. A little more than irksome.

The food is really really good but the friendliness of the owner is what really makes a difference.I have been twice now. The first time alone and i had the burger with spicy fries. The burger was perfectly cooked, perfectly seasoned and all around solid burger.The owner Tom came out from the kitchen and asked how it was and sat and talked for a while. Great experience!I went back today with my wife and we had the mussels in white wine sauce, pulled pork sandwich, and truffle burger. All were excellent. I definitely see this restaurant becoming a place that i will frequent.

Excellent! Food was so yummy and tasted fresh. Everything we had tasted as if it were a home cooked meal from mom's kitchen. The owners  are also really sweet and made sure we were satisfied with our meal. I usually don't like it when people keep checking up on you and asking if you need this and that every 5 minutes but it wasn't like that at Juniper. They would nonchalantly pass by look over and refill our drinks, napkins, bring over more gravy (which was a plus!) I just hope this spot doesn't become so popular and over crowded  becoming like all the other overfilled hipsterlicious dining establishments in the hood. Almost makes me want to erase my review.........

Jambalaya was insane!!!  Byob is great. Didi is SO NICE. Fish fry was amazing and the sweet potato fries delicious. My friends go all the time and raved about how mysteriously amazing this place is. I agree!

I've been here 4 times... -the place looks quiet, and a bit low key, but it's truly a gem. First off- the menu is great: pulled pork sliders, mussels, jambalaya, chicken wings, rib sandwiches, chorizo burgers... quite a robust, yet simple collection of snacks. Not too pricey either!The owner wrote the menu, and does all the cooking himself!The staff may seem reserved, but when you get to know them, are true, down-to-earth folks, all with a great sense of humor! This place has a great backyard for when the summer hits- and is in a prime location.I recommend stopping in for dinner on the way home from work, or lunch if you're in the area. This is also a perfect spot for a solo meal- It's not too hectic, and not too quiet. You're guaranteed a hearty meal at Juniper.
seriously the best burger and sweet potato fries ive had in NY. not to mention the space is cozy and uncrowded-- at least when i went on a friday night !

our daring serving was wearing all white from head to toe. i couldn't believe it, but there she was flying in the face of inevitable sauce spillage. it's not like that was the uniform or anything, it was quite apparent the staff could wear what they wanted to. the restaurant was packed with people, i suppose i shouldn't have been surprised considering how cozy the place was. oh and the kicker, our server didn't spill anything on herself at all! guess i should've stayed longer.

Three-and-a-half stars.Trekking along the treacherous Bedford strip, you find yourself in the market for a no-frills burger, baked mac 'n cheese or simply a delicious pulled pork sandwich. Having grown tired of the crowded establishments that litter this neighborhood, you just want to kick back with a few friends and grab some comfort food. That's when you take a turn towards Berry Street and happen upon Juniper. With no crowds to brave, Juniper is arguably as good as, if not better than, establishments like The Meatball Shop and DuMont Burger.  Of course, the execution is not perfect at Juniper and if you seek a restaurant with an alcohol license (Juniper is BYOB), refined service and the perfect ambiance, best you look elsewhere. That is not what you are seeking now though, is it? Perhaps you're just commencing your weekend festivities and require hearty sustenance for your forthcoming journey; perhaps a day of vintage clothes shopping has caused you to crave a catfish sandwich. Whatever the cause of said cravings, rest assured, your appetite should be satiated at Juniper.Having tried the pulled pork sandwich, I am a satisfied customer: served on a brioche bun this tender, juicy and flavorful concoction is served with your choice of sweet potato, regular or spicy fries. As far as pulled pork sandwiches go, this is as good a specimen as one could reasonably hope to find. That is not to say that it is the best in show, but there is very little about which to complain.Conclusion: This is not a destination restaurant by any means but, as a neighborhood spot, you can expect consistently delicious cuisine devoid of airs and graces. The only surprising element is that Juniper is not nearly as busy as it should be, relative to the over-hyped establishments around the corner.

Took my husband and his family here for his birthday, and we were not disappointed with either the price or the food. The mussels were amazing, the burgers absolutely sublime. I totally recommend the truffle burger with gouda cheese - you really can't go wrong. I even got it sans bun and it was delicious. My husband, a burger fanatic, loved this place. We are definitely returning in the near future.

BRING AN ENMPTY STOMACH!!!  Really great stick to your ribs  New Orleans style  cooking. Owner chef Tom does a nice job with his spicing, nice subtle heat. Portions are HUGE! No liquor license yet, but he says its coming in a few months. THey have a backyard and he plans on doing as shrimp or crawfish boil for the summer. Sounds delicious!

The good:  had a very tasty burger.The bad:  Nice folks but horrendous service.  I asked for napkins 3 times and eventually had to get them myself.  I never received any kind of utensils at all.  It also took over an hour to get my burger.  This place isn't that big so it couldn't have been because they were that backed up - it was just poor service.No liquor license means it's BYOB which is just a pain in the ass.If you sit in the back you occasionally get a powerful whiff of bird shit from the pigeon coop next door.  This isn't their fault at all but is still a knock against the restaurant.The burger was good but not enough to compensate for the other factors.  Giving three stars due to the nice people and good food but still will not return.

3.5 * Good but not great. The truffle burger was good but I ordered medium and got it well done. The wait for food was very long considering we were the only customers there over 20 min for apps and about 45 min for a burger and noodles dish. The waitress was attentive and friendly and the food tasted good but Juniper didn't live up to the hype in my opinion. The pulled pork came out so hot that I wonder if it was microwaved before it came out but it did taste good after it cooled down. The chicken tenders were good. If your in the mood for pulled pork I would go here but better burgers can be found elsewhere.

Excellent! Food was so yummy and tasted fresh. Everything we had tasted as if it were a home cooked meal from mom's kitchen. The owners  are also really sweet and made sure we were satisfied with our meal. I usually don't like it when people keep checking up on you and asking if you need this and that every 5 minutes but it wasn't like that at Juniper. They would nonchalantly pass by look over and refill our drinks, napkins, bring over more gravy (which was a plus!) I just hope this spot doesn't become so popular and over crowded  becoming like all the other overfilled hipsterlicious dining establishments in the hood. Almost makes me want to erase my review.........

Jambalaya was insane!!!  Byob is great. Didi is SO NICE. Fish fry was amazing and the sweet potato fries delicious. My friends go all the time and raved about how mysteriously amazing this place is. I agree!

Not too pricey either!The owner wrote the menu, and does all the cooking himself!The staff may seem reserved, but when you get to know them, are true, down-to-earth folks, all with a great sense of humor! This place has a great backyard for when the summer hits- and is in a prime location.I recommend stopping in for dinner on the way home from work, or lunch if you're in the area. This is also a perfect spot for a solo meal- It's not too hectic, and not too quiet. You're guaranteed a hearty meal at Juniper.
seriously the best burger and sweet potato fries ive had in NY. not to mention the space is cozy and uncrowded-- at least when i went on a friday night !

The wait for food was very long considering we were the only customers there over 20 min for apps and about 45 min for a burger and noodles dish. The waitress was attentive and friendly and the food tasted good but Juniper didn't live up to the hype in my opinion. The pulled pork came out so hot that I wonder if it was microwaved before it came out but it did taste good after it cooled down. The chicken tenders were good. If your in the mood for pulled pork I would go here but better burgers can be found elsewhere.
Best Mac-n-cheese in my life !!!!!!!!! Fried shrimp is a very tasty addition, my bf is addicted to sweet-n-spicy potato fries .....we are regulars there...thank you

Unfortunately my experience wasn't great.It took an hour for us to get any food. This is the reason for such a low rating. I will after a frustrating long wait the food was pretty good. Had the sliders and the meat was delicious. The mussels were very tasty and the pork sliders were also very tasty but the Mac and Cheese was a bit of a let down. As good as the food was I won't be going back due to the very slow service.

Just been in there for dinner with my wife. She had the grilled cheese, I splurged on a truffle burger. The food was excellent - the burger was up there with the likes of DuMont. Decor is a bit sparse, but this is a great place to go for some BBQ comfort food. I'd definitely go back there!

This place was great. I had a bite of my boyfriend's delicious truffle burger (note: get the truffle burger with gouda cheese, as advised by the chef) and ate up all of my cheesesteak and spicy fries. I love the laid back vibe and the old cash register. Staff was attentive and friendly. Excellent!

Just had their wings....got the bbq ones since I don't like spicy things. THey were perfect. Nice and crispy on the outside with lots of sauce and really hot. They even had a tiny kick to them because the sauce has some spiciness to it.

Juniper is my favorite neighborhood spot. So downhome and friendly. Everyone that works here is Asian. They are seriously stereotype-busting with their southern fried comfort food - I always order the truffle burger with gouda cheese and spicy fries.  Daresay I believe their burgers better than DuMont (which still holds mac and cheese crown in my book.)I think they may be suffering some growing pains a bit from becoming a smash success -  but certainly they are the nicest folks on the block, and deserve their great reputation.  Be patient during the lunch and dinner rush, or if you are a neighborhood person, come around closing time (10-11pm) to chat with the owners and the regulars.

Best. Restaurant. In. Williamsburg. Pull pork - better than Fette Sau (3rd best) or Mables (2nd best) or Pies and Thighs (not good). Wings - ridiculous. JUST f'ing great. Beer/ Wine/ Liqueur - BYOB - Love it. Lends to the "mom's kitchen" appeal. mac n Chz - wowsers. I love this place so much.

Juniper opened a couple of months ago and I thought we should check it out. From the outside the atmosphere and decor appear lacking, rather bare and uninviting. People often peak into the window just to find an empty restaurant inside and walk away. Indeed, Juniper is not the most happening place in Wburg. Part poor decor, part lack of liqour license, its quietness is a self fulfilled prophecy. However those of us who do step in and get a table are up for a pleasant surprise: what the restaurant lacks in atmosphere the chef makes up in quality of food. Having been here twice I must attest to other reviewers: the dishes are excellent, inexpensive and quite varied. Linguini are perfectly al dante, shrimp are plump and succulent, burgers are juicy and flavorful, sandwiches are well assembled with all ingredients in perfect harmony. The menu, while not large, has dishes from several cuisines: Italian, Chinese, Korean and American with the latter being particularly good choice.Service, as many have noted, is excellent: the only waiter is friendly and actually honest about the dishes. Food arrives quickly.Next time you walk by Juniper and see empty tables and bare walls inside, give it a try: not all jewels sparkle.

Excellent service and a cute, homey restaurant in the middle of Williamsburg. I usually order the buffalo wings (which...wow) and sweet potato fries. Their newly introduced Jumbalaya is also a fantastic treat. Juniper is great for both a midday meal and a nice, filling and delicious dinner with friends. Definitely one of my hole in the wall BK faves.
Had about everything on the menu and all good stuff!
Best Mac-n-cheese in my life !!!!!!!!! Fried shrimp is a very tasty addition, my bf is addicted to sweet-n-spicy potato fries .....we are regulars there...thank you

Unfortunately my experience wasn't great.It took an hour for us to get any food. This is the reason for such a low rating. I will after a frustrating long wait the food was pretty good. Had the sliders and the meat was delicious. The mussels were very tasty and the pork sliders were also very tasty but the Mac and Cheese was a bit of a let down. As good as the food was I won't be going back due to the very slow service.

Definitely one of my hole in the wall BK faves.
Had about everything on the menu and all good stuff!

I was in Brooklyn one evening for work at the end of March (2012).  I was on my own, looking for a good place to eat after a long day of walking all over the city.  I found this place after seeing the positive reviews - all I can say is "Thank you!".Since I had not eaten, I decided to go with the popular choices I had read about of pulled pork and sweet potato fries.  I also ordered a salad to start things off.The salad was huge but great.  The pulled pork was great as well.  A little kick, but nothing you cannot handle.  With the sweet bread it was on, this was really good.There were a ton of fries and they were fresh tasting - not stale or mushy.  The cook was very friendly and nice, as he came out to talk and see how things were.  The locals having a beer and watching the game were funny and having a great conversation, along with the bartender/host.  It made me wish I lived in the area to hang out there. Nothing fancy about this place, but great food and a good time.  I look forward to my next trip out there to eat again.  Thanks!
Food is bananas!  Cat fish sandwich!  Luv it...... burger the bomb....pull pork pull up to the table baby.......only thing missing ice cold beer.......

I stumbled upon this place one day in the rain with a friend in search of jambalaya, and sure enough they had it advertised in the window.  We went in, ordered the jambalaya and catfish sandwich with spicy fries, and everything was delicious!  It is probably the best catfish sandwich I've ever had, cooked perfectly, and I've gone back already because I crave it!  It's a small place, but they have a great outdoor patio in the back, and best of all it's BYOB! Prices are moderate, the chef is really nice and comes out to greet the guests and makes sure everyone is enjoying their meal, and it's just a low key, great restaurant.  Definitely recommend and will go back again!

Crazy delicious burger, so juicy and perfectly medium. The buns are insanely good and the fries (do spicy) were perfect - my favorite style. The service was attentive and personal. I loved this place. Will be back.

Real people, real food.  We stumbled upon this place while in the area.  At first I was a bit hesitant, because it was lunch hour and there wasn't a soul in the place minus the staff.  We took our chances even after learning that they're cash only and the nearest atm is about a block away.  I'm really glad we stayed because the food is AMAZING.  The owner and chef, Tom, went to the back to prepare our food right after we ordered and returned with platefuls of American style goodness.  We had the spicy buffalo wings, pulled pork sandwich and truffle burger.  The servings were Texas sized in a good way, because I would gladly have eaten them as leftovers the next day.  The wings were gigantic and so juicy.  My truffle burger was the best of the bunch as it was juicy, flavorful, and way better than some upscale burger places I've been to.  I can't say much for the pulled pork sandwich, because I'm not a fan of BBQ sauce, which it was dripping from the bf's fingers, but he seemed like he was enjoying it.  We were conflicted between chatting with Tom and shoving our faces with his cooking since both activities were enjoyable.  He's a genuine guy with a passion for his art.  This place is a no brainer if you're in the area.  Hell, come even if you're not in the area. It'll be worth it.
I highly, highly, highly recommend the Cobb salad, udon soup, jambalaya, the sweet potato fries, and the mussels. Yes, it's that good!!
Awesome foods and cheap ! Mussels, Pulled pork slider with fries, cajun shrimp salad and the Catfish sandwich were awesome !

Juniper is pretty great. It's a quiet and low-key restaurant. On the night I went there, my friend and I were the only two people in the place. I had the burger and fries. The burger was great, but the fries tasted like the frozen Alexia ones. Juniper has a neat backyard patio with lots of tables and chairs. Like many other Williamsburg establishments--cash only.

BYOB! Need I say more? The food is pretty average (burgers, sandwiches, salads), but you get a lot for your money and hey, you brought your own beer, so your bill is already going to be really reasonable. I had the Cajun shrimp salad and honestly, it was better than most shrimp salads I've had - the shrimp were really big and didn't taste fishy or old, so for $12, I'll take it. The backyard is quite pretty, and it's nice and quiet, with rarely more than a few people, so you can bring all of your friends and know you'll be able to get a table. The service is outstanding - the woman who runs it is super nice and not afraid to joke around with you, which makes for a fun meal overall. I'll be back soon,  no doubt about it.

My boyfriend and I came here yesterday and we enjoyed it very much. The food was really good. I had a cheese burger with mozzarella. No bun with sweet potato fries plus a mixed green salad. My boyfriend ate a cheddar bacon burger with sweet potato fries and we shared bbq wings. Everything was delicious. Really nice spot. The register was pretty interesting. Very antique and vintage. I believe he was the owner, very nice guy, said it was made in the 1920s. Loved this place

I was in Brooklyn one evening for work at the end of March (2012).  I was on my own, looking for a good place to eat after a long day of walking all over the city.  I found this place after seeing the positive reviews - all I can say is "Thank you!".Since I had not eaten, I decided to go with the popular choices I had read about of pulled pork and sweet potato fries.  I also ordered a salad to start things off.The salad was huge but great.  The pulled pork was great as well.  A little kick, but nothing you cannot handle.  With the sweet bread it was on, this was really good.There were a ton of fries and they were fresh tasting - not stale or mushy.  The cook was very friendly and nice, as he came out to talk and see how things were.  The locals having a beer and watching the game were funny and having a great conversation, along with the bartender/host.  It made me wish I lived in the area to hang out there. Nothing fancy about this place, but great food and a good time.  I look forward to my next trip out there to eat again.  Thanks!
Food is bananas!  Cat fish sandwich!  Luv it...... burger the bomb....pull pork pull up to the table baby.......only thing missing ice cold beer.......

I stumbled upon this place one day in the rain with a friend in search of jambalaya, and sure enough they had it advertised in the window.  We went in, ordered the jambalaya and catfish sandwich with spicy fries, and everything was delicious!  It is probably the best catfish sandwich I've ever had, cooked perfectly, and I've gone back already because I crave it!  It's a small place, but they have a great outdoor patio in the back, and best of all it's BYOB! Prices are moderate, the chef is really nice and comes out to greet the guests and makes sure everyone is enjoying their meal, and it's just a low key, great restaurant.  Definitely recommend and will go back again!

Crazy delicious burger, so juicy and perfectly medium. The buns are insanely good and the fries (do spicy) were perfect - my favorite style. The service was attentive and personal. I loved this place. Will be back.

Real people, real food.  We stumbled upon this place while in the area.  At first I was a bit hesitant, because it was lunch hour and there wasn't a soul in the place minus the staff.  We took our chances even after learning that they're cash only and the nearest atm is about a block away.  I'm really glad we stayed because the food is AMAZING.  The owner and chef, Tom, went to the back to prepare our food right after we ordered and returned with platefuls of American style goodness.  We had the spicy buffalo wings, pulled pork sandwich and truffle burger.  The servings were Texas sized in a good way, because I would gladly have eaten them as leftovers the next day.  The wings were gigantic and so juicy.  My truffle burger was the best of the bunch as it was juicy, flavorful, and way better than some upscale burger places I've been to.  I can't say much for the pulled pork sandwich, because I'm not a fan of BBQ sauce, which it was dripping from the bf's fingers, but he seemed like he was enjoying it.  We were conflicted between chatting with Tom and shoving our faces with his cooking since both activities were enjoyable.  He's a genuine guy with a passion for his art.  This place is a no brainer if you're in the area.  Hell, come even if you're not in the area. It'll be worth it.
I highly, highly, highly recommend the Cobb salad, udon soup, jambalaya, the sweet potato fries, and the mussels. Yes, it's that good!!
Awesome foods and cheap ! Mussels, Pulled pork slider with fries, cajun shrimp salad and the Catfish sandwich were awesome !

Juniper is pretty great. It's a quiet and low-key restaurant. On the night I went there, my friend and I were the only two people in the place. I had the burger and fries. The burger was great, but the fries tasted like the frozen Alexia ones. Juniper has a neat backyard patio with lots of tables and chairs. Like many other Williamsburg establishments--cash only.

BYOB! Need I say more? The food is pretty average (burgers, sandwiches, salads), but you get a lot for your money and hey, you brought your own beer, so your bill is already going to be really reasonable. I had the Cajun shrimp salad and honestly, it was better than most shrimp salads I've had - the shrimp were really big and didn't taste fishy or old, so for $12, I'll take it. The backyard is quite pretty, and it's nice and quiet, with rarely more than a few people, so you can bring all of your friends and know you'll be able to get a table. The service is outstanding - the woman who runs it is super nice and not afraid to joke around with you, which makes for a fun meal overall. I'll be back soon,  no doubt about it.

My boyfriend and I came here yesterday and we enjoyed it very much. The food was really good. I had a cheese burger with mozzarella. No bun with sweet potato fries plus a mixed green salad. My boyfriend ate a cheddar bacon burger with sweet potato fries and we shared bbq wings. Everything was delicious. Really nice spot. The register was pretty interesting. Very antique and vintage. I believe he was the owner, very nice guy, said it was made in the 1920s. Loved this place

We stumbled into this place after wandering around for an hour trying to decide on a place to eat. The service is friendly and welcoming, and though we couldn't sit in the backyard (private event), the dining space is cozy and laid back. The place is BYOB (which I wish we'd known ahead of time)...and has some of the best fried fish around (sandwich and fish & Chips. Who knew?!? We were looking for decent, and were pleasantly surprised to find fantastic!! If we're ever in the neighborhood again looking for food, we won't have to wander long.

Had a truffle burger was told it was the best thing on the menu. It wasn't that good be honest taste wise 5 Guy's is better yeah that's right. Anyone who raves about this place has never been to a real burger joint for the locals in williamsburg it's probably great anyone with a car can find a much much better burger place then this.. The menu is written on printer paper it looks ghetto and the atmosphere is so dull skip this place

What a gem!  Small but delicious menu, hand-crafted with love.  Chef even came out and talked to all the customers.  Catfish was fantastic, a perfectly seasoned, moist, fluffy pillow of fish on a bun.  Definitely worth stopping by.
Best kept secret in Williamsburg so shhhhhhh

A couple months ago, my roomie and I came here for dinner. We saw there were so many great reviews, so we had to give it a chance. We were seated in the back garden area. I don't know if it was such a good idea because the smell of sewage or toilets flushing kept lingering every couple of minutes. We wanted to move, but thought the smell would go away. It didn't. I ordered a Truffle cheeseburger, my roomie ordered Fried Chicken Tenders battered in Rice Crispies. It tasted really different, light and airy texture. I liked it. My Truffle Cheeseburger, not so good. I felt like the meat tasted really cheap and my medium rare was really chewy with some gritty gristles. Ew. Service was slow too, and the lady didn't really understand when I tried to explain the cheeseburger. Only good thing was the original batter of the Fried Chicken. Also the sweet potato fries were delicious. Who could mess that up?CASH ONLY

everything...everything that is made here is delicious!!!! when I'm in need of a burger i come here...the catfish sandwich is to die for.....sooo good!!!! at the moment its byob. Such a cool chill place! recommend it to everyone and anyone!

Good stuff!!! Just moved here from Texas so looking for a local burger joint.  My bf and I shared a regular grilled burger with cheese and bacon and sweet potato fries and made to order mac n cheese.  Everything was delicious.  Best sweet potato fries I've ever had, they sprinkle cinnamon on the fries.  They totally pop!!  And the mac n cheese, made to order from scratch - a little powdery but good and cheesy.  Definitely coming back!

Folks are keen on the burger, but I'm smitten with their pulled pork sandwich.  Nice, simple and tasty food.  And it's quiet, which is so nice...  The W'burg restaurants are so loud. I'll complain about noise in my next review for the excellent Walter Foods.

you all lied!the burgers are INCREDIBLY overseasoned. the meat flavor was barely perceptible. it reminded me of a bad homeade burger.the fries - both the regular and sweet potato versions - were quite good though.
Juniper is super relaxed and reliably delicious.  The prices are really reasonable and the couple that owns the restaurant are always perfect hosts!

We stumbled into this place after wandering around for an hour trying to decide on a place to eat. The service is friendly and welcoming, and though we couldn't sit in the backyard (private event), the dining space is cozy and laid back. The place is BYOB (which I wish we'd known ahead of time)...and has some of the best fried fish around (sandwich and fish & Chips. Who knew?!? We were looking for decent, and were pleasantly surprised to find fantastic!! If we're ever in the neighborhood again looking for food, we won't have to wander long.

you all lied!the burgers are INCREDIBLY overseasoned. the meat flavor was barely perceptible. it reminded me of a bad homeade burger.the fries - both the regular and sweet potato versions - were quite good though.
Juniper is super relaxed and reliably delicious.  The prices are really reasonable and the couple that owns the restaurant are always perfect hosts!

DELICIOUS! I was looking for wings in the Williamsburg area, and this place came up on Yelp. We ordered food to go (they don't deliver, unlike what it may say on Yelp), and we were sooo pleasantly surprised! I was really just looking for some greasy wings to satisfy my craving, but I got so much more! We ordered two orders of their hot wings, mac and cheese and the sweet potato fries. All of it was amazing! The wings were so juicy, and the mac and cheese was just perfect. It had a bite to it and a breadcrumb crumble on top. The sweet potato fries were out of this world I usually prefer regular fries, but, I have to say, these have converted me! Also, We showed up to pick up our order about 10 minutes early in hopes it would be ready. They threw in a slice of chocolate mousse cake because we had to wait! (extra points for that!)I cannot wait to go back and sit down to eat.

Excellent food. You know it's made with passion. I tend to stick with the dish I liked the last time I went to a restaurant, but with Juniper, I know I can order anything and not be disappointed. Chef is super attentive and the wait staff is friendly and efficient. For first timers I recommend: chicken tenders or pulled pork sliders for appetizers. catfish sandwich for entree.
The catfish sandwich is a win every time. Its also BYOB.
got the chorizo burger.  it was fantastic.  went there on a wednesday night.  it was empty there.  very nice staff

First time to Williamsburg and Brooklyn, where we decided to get a greasy burger to recover from the night before. We all went with the regular grilled burger and fries (I got the spicy [waffle] fries), a solid decision on our part. Good price at 9 bucks before tax, plus friendly chinese owners from Hong Kong that run this little place like the hole-in-the-wall joints we all love.

UN-F*CKING BELIEVABLE! THIS PLACE IS AWESOME!EAT HERE NOW! BEST BURGER IN WILLIAMSBURG!!!!MUST TRY THE RICE KRISPIE CHICKEN FINGERS. ORGASMIC!Sorry for all the caps lock... I really love this place. Everything about it is perfect. The owner Tom is one hella friendly guy.
I wanted to love Juniper but their burger left my stomach quite unhappy.  If you've got an iron gut and can manage the Sysco quality beef, go for it.  The mac n cheese was good.

Walked by here multiple times and never felt the urge to come in here because it didn't look too appealing. But after reading the reviews, thought I'd give it a try. This place is a no frills, chill restaurant. The food is absolutely great for the prices and it's BYOB. Service was amazing as the woman behind the counter was very attentive. We just put down our beers and without asking, she just came over, took it, and poured us a glass. That was unexpected. Breakdown of the food:-BBq wings: it was very crispy, saucy and flavorful. Will try the hot wings next time.-Fish and chips: this is not just a few pieces of fried fish..this is a WHOLE slab of one side of the fish. I mean this was HUGE. It was perfectly fried and the spicy fries were the perfect compliment. I just wished the vinegar was more vinegary.-mussels: very fresh and loved the garlic-ness of the bread but not the bread. The broth was good but a bit salty. Regardless, the mussels were well worth it and a good entree for one person even though it's an appetizer.I will definitely come back here to try the other great looking dishes. Next time, I'll def opt for the mac n cheese and pulled pork that everyone is raving about.
Perfectly cooked fish and chips. Delicious.
i probably come to juniper once a week. it's near work, it's chill and it's absolutely delicious.friendly staff and delicious food.that's all you need to know!

DELICIOUS! I was looking for wings in the Williamsburg area, and this place came up on Yelp. We ordered food to go (they don't deliver, unlike what it may say on Yelp), and we were sooo pleasantly surprised! The sweet potato fries were out of this world I usually prefer regular fries, but, I have to say, these have converted me! Also, We showed up to pick up our order about 10 minutes early in hopes it would be ready. They threw in a slice of chocolate mousse cake because we had to wait! (extra points for that!)I cannot wait to go back and sit down to eat.

It was perfectly fried and the spicy fries were the perfect compliment. I just wished the vinegar was more vinegary.-mussels: very fresh and loved the garlic-ness of the bread but not the bread. The broth was good but a bit salty. Regardless, the mussels were well worth it and a good entree for one person even though it's an appetizer.I will definitely come back here to try the other great looking dishes. Next time, I'll def opt for the mac n cheese and pulled pork that everyone is raving about.
Perfectly cooked fish and chips. Delicious.
i probably come to juniper once a week. it's near work, it's chill and it's absolutely delicious.friendly staff and delicious food.that's all you need to know!
Ugh.... We have been sitting here an hour and still no food!!! We only ordered some appetizers. I won't be back, that's for sure!

What a gem. The best spicy fries and the best sweet potato fries I've ever had. And the portobello sandwich was yummy. Dinner for two with a huge salad for about $30 (bring your own beer). When you see a show at the Music Hall of Williamsburg, be sure to have dinner here. You won't regret it!
Some of the best buffalo wings in NYC. Mac n cheese is really delicious here as well.

I've walked by here many times, often thinking--that poor place is always empty. What's going on there? I don't know. Guess I'll just hustle down to La Superior or Oasis for a cheap bite. I had no idea what they were serving or where it fit into my local dining needs. Then one day, I needed a quiet place for a meeting with a friend, one where we could linger and sort out details, yap and eat without worrying we were annoying people or overstaying our welcome. Hello, Juniper. Surprise, surprise. The food was damn good. I had a BBQ pork sandwich, slow cooked and slathered with sauce. It was huge and tasty. Sweet potato fries were well done too. This place deserves more love, Wburgers.
Mac and cheese and spicy fries 10+

A really great new restaurant on Bedford with fantastic prices.The food is really great here.  Similar to Meg got the catfish sandwish which was outstanding - it was lightly breaded and not at all greasy.  The spicey fries were also crispy but not burned.  Also got the truffle burger.....not like you can go wrong with truffle oil period.......but it was really amazing to be able to get a burger rare - unlike what you would get at Teddy's when you order a rare burger.  Again, the regular fries were yummy.The fact that we also got such a great and filling dinner for under $30 in Williamsburg - consider me sold.We will definitely be back again - as this may be our  new local haunt.The staff is beyond polite and pleasant.  They are truly focused on giving you a great experience. Highly suggested!
Good burger and fries here, but it took ages to get our food - hence the lower review.  Only one waitress - and from what it seemed, only 1 cook.

This place is the definition of "unassuming." Very simple atmosphere with some seriously amazing food. We had two specials, the catfish sandwich and the jambalaya, and both were perfect. Also try the sweet potato fries. The menu ranged from cajun to Japanese, and when we asked our waitress where the chef was from she said with a laugh, "Jail. No seriously -- jail." Note that it's BYOB and cash only.

A gem!!! Outdoor + BYOB + fantastic BBQ combined with prompt and informed service. We were a group of 8 and everyone was very satisfied with the quality of the meal and the overall ambience of the restaurant. Don't be put off if the restaurant itself is empty when you walk in- most people tend to sit in the outdoor area towards the back of the restaurant. Great if you're dining with a big group!

The service here was kinda slow, but it had a dive feel, so I guess that's part of the charm. We were warned about the hot wings, but even the bbq ones made us tear up at first. The cajun fries were delicious, as was the pulled pork sandwich.
Ugh.... We have been sitting here an hour and still no food!!! We only ordered some appetizers. I won't be back, that's for sure!

What a gem. The best spicy fries and the best sweet potato fries I've ever had. And the portobello sandwich was yummy. Dinner for two with a huge salad for about $30 (bring your own beer). When you see a show at the Music Hall of Williamsburg, be sure to have dinner here. You won't regret it!
Some of the best buffalo wings in NYC. Mac n cheese is really delicious here as well.

Highly suggested!

Also try the sweet potato fries. The menu ranged from cajun to Japanese, and when we asked our waitress where the chef was from she said with a laugh, "Jail. No seriously -- jail." Note that it's BYOB and cash only.

A gem!!! Outdoor + BYOB + fantastic BBQ combined with prompt and informed service. We were a group of 8 and everyone was very satisfied with the quality of the meal and the overall ambience of the restaurant. Don't be put off if the restaurant itself is empty when you walk in- most people tend to sit in the outdoor area towards the back of the restaurant. Great if you're dining with a big group!

The service here was kinda slow, but it had a dive feel, so I guess that's part of the charm. We were warned about the hot wings, but even the bbq ones made us tear up at first. The cajun fries were delicious, as was the pulled pork sandwich.

One of the best pulled pork sandwiches in NYC! Salad was quite good and only $5. Can't believe I ever passed this up to eat at the BK Flea. Do yourself a favor and skip the food vendors, this place is a new favorite.

While we really enjoyed the tasty food and the friendly servers, the WAIT for the food's arrival was, perhaps, the longest I've ever experienced. It was bizarre to watch the plates arrive one, maybe two at a time, every ten minutes, then get distributed to each unfed table. While we sat and sat and sat: hungry and puzzled. Note to owner: hire more staff!! Not likely to return.

Juniper continues to rock! I'm basically here every week now. Worked my way through the menu and it's all good. My personal favs are wings or chicken fingers to start. Then I typically grab a burger, the pulled pork sandwich or the catfish sandwich. Actually, I order the catfish sandwich most frequently. Owner comes out to say hello almost every time. Business has picked up as its typically busy on Friday night and weekends. This is one of my go-to spots in the neighborhood. Prices are reasonable. Can't recommend it enough!

Absolutely delicious. I'm literally sitting in here right now finishing up a bowl of mac-n-cheese that will blow your mind. The Jambalaya is seriously tasty as well. It's BYOB so that's pretty sweet. The only negative (kind of) thing is that the menu is sort of small - it's just so good that I want more!

I've been going to Juniper on a weekly basis the last couple months with my coworkers in the afternoon and for dinner with the girlfriend. It's consistently delicious and a pleasant dinning experience. A couple of dishes I suggest:*The sweet potato fries- the best I've found in Williamsburg, crispy and dusted with brown sugar (much like the sweet potato fries at Boka (E.V.) I love so much). I couldn't even get them today as apparently everyone was "ordering them like they were going out of style." -actual quote*The steak and cheese sandwich - almost as good as those ridiculous fries. The burger and BBQ rib sandwich are no slouches either. It's debatable which is better, but the S&C sammy was the standout for me and worth the workout burning it off.*The chicken fried steak - it's a daily special and not always available so snag it if you see it and enjoy some southern comfort food (I have a feeling the jambalaya is the same way). It's typically a large portion so come hungry for this one.Aside from that, I hear from coworkers that the mushroom udon (another special) is good and I'm curious to try more of their seafood dishes. The owners are great, the large front windows are nice to sit and sun in, they are finally delivering and the back patio will be open soon so I expect great things from this little place.

Best kept secret in Brooklyn! I have eaten pulled pork at every major BBQ place in the city and Juniper has the best. The rib sandwich is a close second.  Really, everything they make is delicious. The owner is cool and always asks you if you enjoyed your food.

I just finished my Leftovers from earlier today and they were so good! The place is small and sweet. Aesthetically appealing but no way overwhelming. and the owner is very cool. I tried my friends meal and it was just as delicious. Everything was fresh and prepared with care. I Hope this place grows in popularity and the food remains just as great if not better!
On point! Ordered the pulled pork and its one of the best pulled pork I had anywhere. I'm gotta admit I'm really surprised considering the area. I will order it again to see if they are consistent.
Great burger!

I've walked by it, checked out its menu, peered into it, but never actually stepped into it until my friend took me there recently.  Thank gawd!  I LOVE sweet potato fries, and theirs is AWESOME.  So flavorful and crispy!  Like everyone else said, their catfish sandwich was really, really good.  Like everyone else also said, the chef-owner came out and chatted and seems to be a great guy who loves what he does -- which definitely shows in the quality of the food.  So I guess whatever I have to say has already been said...except that if this venture does not succeed, I will be very, very disappointed in all of you.  Go and hand over some of your hard-earned money NOW.

One of the best pulled pork sandwiches in NYC! Salad was quite good and only $5. Can't believe I ever passed this up to eat at the BK Flea. Do yourself a favor and skip the food vendors, this place is a new favorite.

Business has picked up as its typically busy on Friday night and weekends. This is one of my go-to spots in the neighborhood. Prices are reasonable. Can't recommend it enough!

Absolutely delicious. I'm literally sitting in here right now finishing up a bowl of mac-n-cheese that will blow your mind. The Jambalaya is seriously tasty as well. It's BYOB so that's pretty sweet. The only negative (kind of) thing is that the menu is sort of small - it's just so good that I want more!

I've been going to Juniper on a weekly basis the last couple months with my coworkers in the afternoon and for dinner with the girlfriend. It's consistently delicious and a pleasant dinning experience. A couple of dishes I suggest:*The sweet potato fries- the best I've found in Williamsburg, crispy and dusted with brown sugar (much like the sweet potato fries at Boka (E.V.) I love so much). I couldn't even get them today as apparently everyone was "ordering them like they were going out of style." -actual quote*The steak and cheese sandwich - almost as good as those ridiculous fries. The burger and BBQ rib sandwich are no slouches either. It's debatable which is better, but the S&C sammy was the standout for me and worth the workout burning it off.*The chicken fried steak - it's a daily special and not always available so snag it if you see it and enjoy some southern comfort food (I have a feeling the jambalaya is the same way). It's typically a large portion so come hungry for this one.Aside from that, I hear from coworkers that the mushroom udon (another special) is good and I'm curious to try more of their seafood dishes. The owners are great, the large front windows are nice to sit and sun in, they are finally delivering and the back patio will be open soon so I expect great things from this little place.

Best kept secret in Brooklyn! I have eaten pulled pork at every major BBQ place in the city and Juniper has the best. The rib sandwich is a close second.  Really, everything they make is delicious. The owner is cool and always asks you if you enjoyed your food.

I just finished my Leftovers from earlier today and they were so good! The place is small and sweet. Aesthetically appealing but no way overwhelming. and the owner is very cool. I tried my friends meal and it was just as delicious. Everything was fresh and prepared with care. I Hope this place grows in popularity and the food remains just as great if not better!
On point! Ordered the pulled pork and its one of the best pulled pork I had anywhere. I'm gotta admit I'm really surprised considering the area. I will order it again to see if they are consistent.
Great burger!

I've walked by it, checked out its menu, peered into it, but never actually stepped into it until my friend took me there recently.  Thank gawd!  I LOVE sweet potato fries, and theirs is AWESOME.  So flavorful and crispy!  Like everyone else said, their catfish sandwich was really, really good.  Like everyone else also said, the chef-owner came out and chatted and seems to be a great guy who loves what he does -- which definitely shows in the quality of the food.  So I guess whatever I have to say has already been said...except that if this venture does not succeed, I will be very, very disappointed in all of you.  Go and hand over some of your hard-earned money NOW.

This place wasn't so great. The regular grilled burger is just the meat, and a bun. When we asked if the burger came with lettuce or tomato she said no. They gave us one slice of tomato and one slice of lettuce in replacement of the side salad. A whole salad for just one slice of each? Not really right portion and price wise. I ordered the regular fries with my burger & my boyfriend ordered the spicy fries. They put the spicy fries on my plate and the regular fries on his. Thank god the "spicy" fries were not actually spicy...at all...in any way. They should be named "seasoned or unseasoned." But realistically there were only 2-3 tables of people, the order shouldn't have been confused. We asked for another ketchup bottle because ours was empty, when she brought it back she had an attitude about us already having a ketchup bottle on our table. The bottle wasn't even red, it looked more like BBQ sauce. After the meal I tried to pay the bill with my card, oh no....only cash is accepted. Thank god I had a $100 bill hidden in my purse otherwise we wouldn't have been able to pay the bill. This is 2014, update the technology and accept cards. The food itself was alright, the fries were good. My boyfriend liked the burger but I wasn't a fan, the meat was just too thick for me.
Everything is amazing here!! Ande the owner is a sweetheart n personal with his customers=]

Went there a couple of days ago and had the burger which was pretty delicious.  The fries were great as well.  The place is still pretty new so the owner who is also the cook came out and introduced himself to us.  He was super friendly and even gave us a free sample of the pulled pork sandwiches which were absolutely delicious! Overall, great food and even better customer services.  Good place to bring a date...
great fries - I loved the sweet potato fries!! Burgers were pretty good.

I was walking down Bedford on sunny Sunday afternoon looking for somewhere to sit down, eat, and work  on my laptop and there was just nothing, absolutely nothing. I dipped down to Berry and was happy to stumble upon this place. It felt like a good old Cheers kinda place. It was nice to be somewhere normal with people who were not trying to be styley and aloof but just treat you like a human being. Good reasonably priced  food. I talked to the owner and (I think she is) his wife, Super nice people. I only wish they had wireless so I could hang out and work there more, but I understand why they might not want to do that.

rtions are huge for the price which is very reasonable. Staff is like family. Very friendly. For a recommendation, just choose what you like to eat and even be adventurous because you won't be disappointed.
Pulled pork sandwich was good and great sweet potato fries.  good local joint.

Picked up some bar/kids food to go this weekend to enjoy with beers before the waterfront concert.  Wings, Mac n Cheese and Chicken Fingers.  The chicken fingers are made with rice krispies to give them a little extra pleasing crunch when you bite into them.  I love when someone cares enough about otherwise simple bar food to pay attention to these types of details.  Nothing dissapoints here.

I am moving from New York very soon, and Juniper will be one of the things I miss most about living in Williamsburg.  The food is amazing, the owners are super nice and interesting people, and the vibe at the restaurant is a relief from a lot of the surrounding places in this neighborhood.  I love coming here.  I'm a vegetarian, so I can't give a lot of recommendations, but I do heartily recommend the udon soup.

Was there last night with 6 friends for my birthday.  Could not have asked for anything better from this place.  The place is not too small and not too large.  Service felt personalized even though there were 5 other groups there.  The BYO feature was a definite plus.  I'll be honest and say I don't really remember leaving but I do remember the food.  EVERYTHING I ate was incredible.  We had Mac N Cheese for the table (2 orders), a number of BBQ Rib sandwiches, a chorizo burger, a regular burger, and an order of muscles.  Some had sweet potato fries and others had the spicy fries.  And these weren't just spicy for the sake of having a spicy fries option.  They were damn good spicy fries.  And no they weren't burn-a-hole-in-your-sphincter spicy.  They were actually flavorful, spicy fries.  I am definitely headed back for more.  btw: they even have a TV there in the event you absolutely need to watch the game.  We had them put the Knicks on and all was right with the world that evening, in addition to it being my birthday.  To sum up using an entirely tangential point, this place was so enjoyable that we had our host (and owner btw) poor shots for not just our table but the other tables as well... some of whom actually drank them and others who preferred to remember some of their Saturday night.Oh and we had not one but two chef interactions.  Super nice and friendly guy.  Do yourselves a favor a go to this place.  We don't want them going anywhere.Final final final words.  I've been to Fette Sau and this place is better, period.  The vibe here is better and the service is better.  Hell, there is no service at Fette Sau and good luck finding a seat at that place.  Fette Sau is good but you aren't doing anything there other than eating.  Juniper is a place to actually enjoy yourself while having great food.  Though let me also say that this isn't just a BBQ place. So if you are looking for straight up brisket by the pound, go elsewhere.  But if you crave what Juniper's menu offers, definitely come.

They gave us one slice of tomato and one slice of lettuce in replacement of the side salad. A whole salad for just one slice of each? Not really right portion and price wise. I ordered the regular fries with my burger & my boyfriend ordered the spicy fries. They put the spicy fries on my plate and the regular fries on his. Thank god the "spicy" fries were not actually spicy...at all...in any way. They should be named "seasoned or unseasoned." But realistically there were only 2-3 tables of people, the order shouldn't have been confused. We asked for another ketchup bottle because ours was empty, when she brought it back she had an attitude about us already having a ketchup bottle on our table. The bottle wasn't even red, it looked more like BBQ sauce. After the meal I tried to pay the bill with my card, oh no....only cash is accepted. Thank god I had a $100 bill hidden in my purse otherwise we wouldn't have been able to pay the bill. This is 2014, update the technology and accept cards. The food itself was alright, the fries were good. My boyfriend liked the burger but I wasn't a fan, the meat was just too thick for me.

Overall, great food and even better customer services.  Good place to bring a date...

So if you are looking for straight up brisket by the pound, go elsewhere.  But if you crave what Juniper's menu offers, definitely come.

Went here with my girlfriend after an evening of exploring the surrounding area. It's definitely in a cute location, but it's not the location that made it great. I had the truffle burger and I have to say it was the best burger I've ever eaten. This notion was definitely helped by the fact that the place is BYOB (or BYORW in our case). The service was especially friendly, which I was expecting to be awful after reading the reviews. Definitely will come back again, something I never thought I would say after eating a burger
Their menu says "Free Delivery Min 10.00",  but when I called they said they don't deliver. Either they are busy or don't want to deliver.  If you're busy then tell me that, but don't lie.

This is why I love YELP! My boyfriend and I were in the mood for a good burger and came across Juniper.  Every single review was consistent and proven accurate after eating there this evening.  The burgers, fries & mac 'n cheese were each to die for.Burgers: the meat was seasoned to perfection and cooked just right.Fries: curly fries and sweet potato fries were amazing.Mac 'n cheese:  we didn't even order this, but the owner (Tom) insisted that we try it "on the house".  It was the ultimate comfort food and was so fresh tasting.Overall, the service and the food were at least 5 stars.  So excited to have a fabulous burger place in the hood!!Everyone needs to go to Juniper and let Tom indroduce you to his passion for great food!
Sweetly run.  Food was affordable, delicious and fast. Casual atmosphere, great vibes. I'll be back!

Just had dinner there and it was SO GOOD we had to rush home to write a rave review.The owners are really friendly and answered all of our questions.  The space is nice and cozy, and had a really laid-back vibe. We went with the pulled pork sandwich with spicy fries and the truffle burger with regular french fries.  Both were so delicious that we didn't know which bite to save for last!  Definitely going to make this a regular spot and try out more of the menu.

I tried this place last night after walking by it for months -- and it was FANTASTIC!  The food was mouth watering, and the chef/owner came out to talk with us.  Very friendly place -- I'll def. be back!
Delicious, juicy burger. Great down-home cafe atmosphere.
BBQ Rib sandwich is the best comfort food in the neighborhood. Good friendly service and no pretentiousness which can sometimes be overwhelming in Williamsburg.

I wish i could give this place a 10 star rating! I signed up to yelp just to write this review. I've been a yelp follower for years and most of the times I try new places its because of great reviews i just never signed up (probably out of laziness). But I love this place so much I want everyone to know about it :) I've been here a few times since I moved to Brooklyn about a year and a half ago, and no other place tops their burgers (not even shake shack no offense) and the prices are not bad. You get what you pay for. I've taken everyone I love to Juniper and nobody has been disappointed. A big plus also is that the Bedford station is down the street and three stops from Union Sq. I actually didn't realize until the last week that I went when I brought my best friend from Yonkers, but I never tried any other plate but the burgers and that's only because she asked what else do you recommend(they are that good) ? You know when you try a new great place you want to try every dish on their menu, yea be warned once you try the burgers you'll be hooked. Anyways I can go on and on, you have to try it yourself to believe me! Only thing though if I were you I would arrive early it gets pretty packed, I wish they would expand. And bring your own beers! Or there's a wine shop across the st. Jeje ;)

I have to give this place 5 stars!!! I looove their food. I live all the way uptown, but I will go to brookyln to eat at juniper. Their Udon Soup is AMAZING! Even if you aren't really into soups, you'll still love it. Fresh mushrooms, perfect flavor, the noodles, it's just amazing. Burgers are great, their sweet potato fries are THE SHIT, salads are pretty good, mussels were great too. The owner is a really nice guy. So friendly and sweet.

Even if you aren't really into soups, you'll still love it. Fresh mushrooms, perfect flavor, the noodles, it's just amazing. Burgers are great, their sweet potato fries are THE SHIT, salads are pretty good, mussels were great too. The owner is a really nice guy. So friendly and sweet.

I wanted to try this place for a long time mainly because the Yelp reviews have been so positive. I called up for a delivery and they told me that 8 blocks was too far because there's a new delivery guy. That's odd, but fine. I'll pick it up myself. Got the pulled pork and the rib sandwich. They both come with french fries. No other option. I think it was $25. Maybe more. Anyway. The fries were cold and soggy, but still kind of good probably because they had so much salt on them. Too many fries though, really. Had to throw away the second side order. A salad option would have been nice. But real problem reason I won't be eating at Juniper again -- the sandwiches. The bread was good, pickle nice. OK, here's the deal-breaker. These are the sauciest sandwiches ever. Do you like sause? Heaping amounts of high-calorie, sticky sweet McDonalds BBQ sause-style sauce? Then maybe you'll like these sandwiches. I didn't. Admittedly, you know you're not have health food when you order this kind of food. But still, it's possible to have a meaty sandwich without feeling disgusting. Disappointed.
Could be the best sweet potato fries I've ever had. Burger was big and delicious. Tom, the owner and chef is a super nice guy. Looking forward to going back and trying the rest of the menu.
This place is excellent.  Quiet, friendly and the best food in Williamsburg.
